choices: It cracks to reveal it's a wooden carving...
122111.content:
You swim towards the reef with a sneakish swag in your new tail. If you were going to eat, you had to be smart. You look for an unsuspecting target, one that wasn't moving.

Some of the seel had seen you already and moved out of the way, while the Majikarp were lazing around. Some of the fish like unevolved forms of yourself even noticed you, but didn't swim away. Eventually the only pokemon species in the reef is the Majikarp.

You see one floating about 9 feet from the surface of the water. You swim up to it and find it very small as you open your mouth. With one gulp you crunch it in your jaw.
122111.title: The Majikarp's Reef

1221111.content:
You savor the taste of the Magikarp, swallowing it whole. It reminded you of sushi. Yum. To your surprise, this meal filled you up. In fact, you felt somewhat bloated. Did Gyrados have a small appetite? You never once remembered being full after only one meal. Then again, you never even remembered being turned into a pokemon either, so you tried not to let your stomach be your main problem.

You swim for some time, pondering about what you should do next. Swimming past several wooden planks conjoined at the ends, you notice you are by a pier. You look out near the shore and see the surfers, swimmers, and small children enjoying themselves above the water.

You're beginning to enjoy your new form. What could go wrong? You're big, strong, and nothing except the 'Pokemon Justice Squad' will ever have the guts to confront you.

Suddenly you felt a small current nudging you from above. You look up to notice that a small child has either swam out too far or fell off the pier. The child looks to be about six years old. Whatever the case, you were guessing the kid didn't know how to swim.
1221111.title: Ruler of...wherever you are

Confused, but happy; he runs back towards his parents, who also saw you help him. Both shocked that a Gyrados had saved their son, not eaten him.

You...

You nod your head in thanks. You marvel your reflection. You are the strongest & unique gyarados.
You decide to travel to...

you keep swimming and find yourself in johto so you decide to explore the

12211111111222.content:
You now knew where you are. You are at Canalave City. You head north to Fullmoon Island. You now noticed you moved a lot quicker. You stare at your reflection again. Wow. I am a really beautiful gyarados. I am also very tough, you thought.

You then arrived at Fullmoon Island in no time, thanks to your strengthened form. You looked around to see a beautiful landscape. You then see a pokemon you don't remember. "I have been expecting you," the pokemon said. "What you have been waiting for me this whole time?" you reply. "Yes. Now come with me," she said. The pokemon floated off into the forest. You follow but when you get close to shore, she picks you up & carries you over to her place.

"Now first let me tell you who I am," she said, "I am Cresselia, the lunar pokemon. I transformed you last night & carried you to Canalave." "Why did you change me!?" you said as calmly as you can. "Because I had a horrible vision. Have you heard of Suicune?" she asked."Yes," you say still a little angry. "She will die in a week unless someone does something. If she dies, the worlds water supply will become toxic. So I chose someone to help me save her," Cresselia explains. "That's me isn't it?" you ask. "Yes, I chose you for your pure heart," she explained, "But being a Gyarados changed you a little. It made you a bit hot-headed," you felt embarassed for losing your temper, "But it did make you strong. But I would never have predicted this happening, a gold Gyarados. Suicune is over near Victory Road. Have you heard enough to be ready to save Suicune?" You nod your head. "Good," she replies. She picks you up & puts you in the water. "May the moon watch over you," she says as you leave.

Where do you go?

You quickly raise your giagantic tail and splash a humungus wave towards the "Pokemon Justice Squad".

"You can't get buy Justice!" The leader screams. "THUNDERBOLT"

Mascot?

you attempt to go on top of the beach but just get stuck. eventualy you work your way to the ocean. "roar roar roar roar roar roar "<bad idea i wont try that again.>

You're floating in the water. You didn't even notice it. You quickly dipp under the water to clear your eyes of what you saw, and you're amazed. You can see atleast two times better underwater than you ever could out on land.

You take this chance to observe yourself better. You're a round blue ball, with big ears, and a zigzagy tail. A Blue ball is on the end of it, and it is floating upward. You can't hold it down and end up floating back to the surface.

"What's that?" You hear a boy yell out from the shore. He holds a pokeball and reads something off of a pokedex before making eye contact with you. "Go!" He throws a pokeball.

1232.content:
You raise your new tail with a bit of trouble, but eventually you get the will to smack the ball back at the trainer. It hits him in the face and he falls over. And by the time he gets ready to try again, You've already started swiming underwater downstream.

Unfortunately for you, you can't get the end of your tail underwater long enough to hide, there's something inside it that keeps it too light to sink.

"I see you!" He raises and arm and an electric shock volts the water. You feel a tingle, but manage to get a look. While the trainer runs alongside the stream, a Raichu runs next to him, while channeling electricity into the water with it's tail.

You immidiately get out on the opposite stream and start to run off.

"Thunderbolt!" he yells, and you faint from a shock much much stronger than before.


Hours later, you wake up. "Good Mornin' Marril!" The boy from earlier says. "Now, about my next battle..."
1232.title: He misses

choices: Oh oh, he's back onto his feet!
12322.content:
Even though he had caught you, you didn't feel loyal to him. And a battle? You were not going to do some battle.

No second thoughts, you shoot a blast of icey cold water into his face and make a run for it. He was stunned, you had some time to get out of his sight.
12322.title: I an't nobodys pet

choices: Try to get help from them
124.content:
You're sitting in a park in a city, near a mini lake.

You hold up a hand and watch it. The gunk begins to slide to the bottom of the hand, and even more of it comes out of your so called "skin." You're sweating this gross stuff right out of you! That's why you feel like water.

You're a huge mound of slimy, gross, smelly, scum. Literaly. Muk. Other than two fingerless stubs of arms, you have no limbs or anything. You just trudge along leaving a trail of sludge and dead grass behind you.

Soon, you notice how people tend to walk away as you trudge up to the street. They want you out of there.

A man with an Alakazam walks up to you, blocking your path.
124.title: Muk

1241.content:
You go up to the trainer and instantly ask millions of questions.

"What am I? Where am I? How did I get turned into MUK!?" You say at first. But only one word comes out of all those words. Muk.

The trainer looks at you in fear and you are afraid yourself. Then the Alakazam looks at you and speaks. All it says is its name, but you can understand it perfectly.

"What do you mean "How did I get turned into Muk?" It asks back in a mocking way. You explain your story on how you woke up as this puddle of Muk in the park, and how you were a human before.

The Alakazam listens and then tells it's trainer something. You don't understand this but you find out what it means.

"HYPNOSIS!" the trainer yells. And you begin to feel yourself falling asleep.

***


When you wake up, your in your bed. No Muk Running down or from your arms. Your just you. Perhaps what you just experienced was all a dream. But it felt so real.

You go to the washroom to check your reflection. You don't see Muk, only you. Your back to normal...


But you suddenly feel something slimy on your leg
:P:P:P:P:P:P
1241.title: Back to normal... Almost

1242.content:
Fearing for your life, you slither in the oposite direction, but it's no use, you're too slow. There's no cover, no ways to escape, you're doomed. Unless...

You slide on top of the sewage drain and call out in surprise. "Muh! Muh! Muk!" Your body seperates, and you slide right through the bars. It's the strangest thing you've ever felt, even stranger than being a giant wad of pollution. It feels cool though.

Once you sink down, you hear everyone relieved. You're gone, they're happy now. It looks like this will be your home until you figure out how to change back.

Suddenly, it dawns on you. Your body is still split up. You think about becoming whole, and suddenly, all the pieces of you swarm over the main part like bugs, and you're instantly whole again. Another wierd experience.

Looking around the dark, groggy sewer you might have to call home, you try to decide how to explore.
1242.title: Into the Sewer

12421.content:
You have to face it. You're too slow to 'walk' around. You swallow your sense of clensliness, and jump into the water.

"It feels so nice..." you think to yourself as you slowly drift along. As you float, your slimy body naturally picks up trash and garbage, and absorbing it. "This must be how I eat." you think again.

Forgeting how you ever thought this would be nasty, you just drift off to sleep, letting the river of filth carry you on.

You wake up beached on some dirt, still in the sewer. You try to slither off again, but find you can't move. You're more than four times larger than you were. You absorbed a lot of water. After puking it out, and finding it to be pure black, you hear something come near toawrd you.

You look around and see a huge machine with brushes and spining things coming at you, cleaning the sewer.

You might just reform after going through that thing, but it might just clean you right out of existance.

The water seems to be leading out into the ocean. If you go in you can escape.
12421.title: Brown Waters

124211.content:
You hold your ground, praying that it's the right decision. The brushes spin, and spin, and thrash around as the shadow of the machinepasses over you, your whole life passes before your eyes.

Well, your whole life as a Muk anyways.

You wake up hours later, feeling crappy and wanting to puke from the smell down here. You stand up on both legs, and walk off in search of a way out of the sewer that a human could actually squeeze through.
124211.title: Cleaned up

124212.content:
You slide into the water, and begin to float toward the bars against the wall. As you get closer, the sound of the cleaning machine is drowned out by the sounds of rushing water.

Once going over the top, and down a mini waterfall, you get forced through a set of bars again, and split up into a bunch of pieces.


After getting to the ocean, you float over to a dock and reform as you pull yourself up. The cries and screams of people all around bug you again. You need to find another place to hide.
124212.title: Back to the city

1242121.content:
You then sile throught the cracks in the dock and ooze back into the dirty, slimy harbor water. You flow your way underneath the dock, swimming past the old wooden pillars, some slightly bent from holding out the weight of the dock. You swim until you reach an aging flat-bottomed whaler, with it's grease cover outboard motor leaking oil into the water. Seeing the oil, watching it flow into the sea water, your mouth feels tingly. You then swim up to the outboard motor and drink the leaking pertoluem. The moment the black stuff hits you tougue, your greated with a grat taste! The taste of the greastest chocolate in the world! A sly smile speads across your face as you slup the suculent oil from the motor. It tastes so good you just realx and close your eyes, almost falling into a food coma.

After a few minutes the oil flow disapates. You try sucking out more and lick the leaking hole with you slimy tougue, but to no evale. You let out a long sigh, relizing the oil is gone. You poke your midsection and notice that you feel slightly bloated. You inspect your body and notice you look a bit rounder. An upwelling come up from you throat and in response you open you mouth, releasing a gigantic belch, filling the air with toxic fumes and a brownish green cloud of gas. As the toxic cloud seems to form a skull and cross bones, you let a some chuckling laughter in response to the belch. Then it hits you you need place to hide.

But that turned out easy, for about twenty next to the whaler was the 25 foot rustbucket of a fishing vessel called the Relic, which exactaly what it was. It was a grey boat, rust streaming down the sides, forming by the waterline. The rusting hulk listed to port, with all it's windows broken except for one smoggy window on the back of the cabin. It's fishing booms where thoughly rusted, tangled in fishing net with chains dangling off the end of the booms and lying on the deck of the boat. It was in great disrepair, looking ancient, abondoned, alone, the perfect hideout! You then swim to the Relic and clim up the stern on to the deck, littered with weathered rope, an old life perserver, and some life jackets in faded orange. You inhale tought your "nose". filling your nostrols with the aroma of dead fish and diesel fuel. To you it smells wonderful. You then slip onto the deck, which lets out a long groan the moment your rather large weight falls upon it. At first it seems you'll fall through the deck, but the deck holds strong. You slip thought the wastland of the deck and ooze down the deck hatch into the engine room. The room is dark and olny lit by the dreary day light slipin tought the open hatch, lacking a hatch cover. You turn to see the boat's diesel engine, once a metal heart humming with life now a lifeless hulk of rusted steel sitting below deck. You slide towards the engine and notice that there is diesel oil, more fermented then the whaler's gasoline grade oil, dripping from the rusted mound forming a small puddle. Noticing the leaking fuel, you decide to...

Your bloated form takes up most of the space on the lower deck, your sides bulged against deck supports, making them lean and bend aside from the weight and pressure. You somehow manage to get up right and look down at your bloated body. You stomach quivers loudly and consantly, shaking like a shivering animal. "So, you new?" "Um, how'd yo uguest?" "Oh, I have a knack for that kinda thing, it's almost a gift really!" You let out a smile, talking to this friendly Grimer. "So, you ever taste that stuff?" Just then....

12522211.content:
'Now, why would my family go to a swamp?' was one of the many questions racing through your head, along with 'Why am I a mudkip?' and such things.

As you jump out the open window of your family's minivan, you feel strangely at home. The dampness, the mud, the wilting trees. It all felt so familiar, yet so different at the same time. Your family continues to walk around aimlessly and comment on the most boring stuff, not even noticing you.

You try to get their attention with a long monologue, but all they manage to hear is "Mudkip, mudkip, mudkip! MUDKIP MUDKIP mudkip, mudkip." Everyone turns around to face you and your mother runs up to you squealing with delight. "Oooo, a mudkip! I've always wanted one of these!" she screams as your brother rolls his eyes. She turns to him. "Henry! Did you bring some pokeballs?" she yells.

Your face gets rather pale at this comment. "No, sorry mom," your brother says semi-sarcastically, "I forgot all of them at home."

"Oh, darn," she says pouting, "I guess this'll have to wait some other time."

"Come on mom, this is boring, let's just go."

"One moment dear, I still have to take some more pictures!"

You sigh a sigh of relief, but realize that you just missed your chance to be able to go back home. You quickly formulate an idea; writing a message in the mud! You quickly dig your paws-- flippers-- whatever they are into the mud spelling out your message. "Mud, mudkip mudkip kip kip kip!" You yell at your family.

It felt like you could do anything with these wings! Deciding to test them out, you start to pump them in such a manner that your body no longer is supported by the ground, but you supported your own weight in mid air. What freedom! You could fly forever...
 
As you fly for hours, you start to notice that the sun is lowering itself beyond the horizon. You should probably turn in for the night, if something happened, you wouldn't know how to help yourself. Tomorrow, perhaps, you can start to try and figure out why you are a pokemon in the first place.
 
Looking down you notice a small town. You tilt you wings downward, aiming for a gigantic tree with pokemon sleeping in the branches. You glide smoothly and perch on a branch with ease, your claws gripping tight into the wood. It felt strangely natural for you to choose such a place. You flicker your eyes into sleep.
 
You awaken to a disturbing knock on your head and quickly register three small boys are throwing rocks at you from the ground. You...

You ruffle your feathers and settle down for a mid-morning nap. You were awaken by a blast of ice-cold water. You took to the air and looked at the sun. About noon. Another blast of water sent you flying a few feet. You see a young boy and a Wartortle. Not that man, thank goodness. "Wartortle it's weakening!" The boy cried out. Weakening? You'll show him! You flap your wings, and when they started glowing powerfully, you knew that this was one wing attack that would top your others. 13221112.content: You decide to pick on the boy some more, before tiring and landing on the ground to rest. "All right, go Raticate!" The Boy called, and within seconds of flashing lights a massive Raticate emerged. You click your beak, slightly annoyed and impressed, at this Youngster's fighting spirit. You use Sand-Attack, and the Raticate rams into a tree, knocking itself out. The Youngster flees, and you decide to fly around the wide park you landed in. People enjoying themselves with picnics, games, and parties marvel at your speed and beauty. One bystander even went as far to say "What a Majestic Pokémon that is!" A shadow catches your sharp eyesight, and you let out a loud cry as you feel electricity flow through your body. Flying types are weak to Electric types, after all. You slowly rise, collapsing slightly as a Raichu appeared, with the same cloaked man as before on the rooftop appeared behind the Raichu. "Finally, I have you within my grasp...." The man took out an Ultra Ball. You feel more volts flow through your body, and you cry out in pain once more. You try pumping your wings to flee, but the electricity is too much for you and you collapse on the ground. As you dream you accept your fate as one of the strange, cloaked man's Pokemon. You wince slightly as you wake, but not in darkness, as a Poke Ball would have been. You instead look around, seeing Pokémon resting on different beds. You click your beak as you look out the window parallel to your left. You see a winding dirt pathway lined with trees, as the grass ripples with the wind. "I see you are awake, Pidgeot! Such a relief, it is...." You look up into the smiling face of Nurse Joy, clicking your beak again. Nurse Joy dips her head and leaves the room, leaving you to rest some more. As you wake up one more, you see the moonlight cast shadows upon your bed and the floor. You decide to silently slip out of your bed and escape into the outdoors, where you belong. You successfully make it out of the room you were in. "Pidgeot, get back in there!" You hear Nurse Joy's voice cry out as you turn, looking up into her stern face and clicking your beak sadly. As you get back into your bed, you hear a nice tune and instantly drift to sleep.

Staring back at you in the refelction is a Primape. The ape like body and big nose confond you. You back up from the reflection and almost fall over your giant feet. 1351.content:
Yes, of course. Why had you not realized it before? You had to be a Dragonaire! You looked deeper into the mirror, taking in every bit of evidence of your transformation. You admired your shiny, sapphire scales. You seemed to be well groomed. Your horn was a beautiful pearly-pink mix, and your gems were polished thoroughly. You were wearing two golden bracelets around your tail, and they seemed to fit perfectly. You were utterly beautiful.

After studying yourself, you turned around to look at the room. It must have been a mansion. There was a large bed nearby, draped in light blue curtains, and bedded in navy. It looked so comfortable you wanted to slither into it now and spend the rest of your life there.
The walls were decorated in a white linear pattern, which you could swear also had been laced.

Miscellaneous things adorned the room as well, such as the mirror, a drawer, a window, and a television set that looked quite expensive. But despite all this, you could tell that since the ceiling was high, your suspicion of the mansion was confirmed. But something still bothered you about all this. You just seemed far too pampered.
1351.title: Close to perfection

You find the large oak door and manage to push it open. It swings smoothly to the left as you begin to slide on your belly down the hall. The walls on your right had, instead of white with lacing, a more maroon color. A warm feeling to a hall..

However, on the left, instead of a wall there were wide windows. As you slithered along you looked out to see a manifold of shaped hedges, flower patches, and a fountain. No doubt whoever owned this estate was a rich person.

Off in the distance you saw a path leading to a small lake and further out you see a city.
Coming to a door on your right, you look down the rest of the hall to see a door at the end. Which do you take?

You seem to be in a cabin of some sort. There is a fire cackling in the grate, and two humans huddled around a bed on the other side of the room. You pick yourself up onto your feet and wobble a bit. Your head is a little off balance because of the crown. One of the humans notice this and looks down at you.

She has long black hair, bright green eyes, and a pair of goggles fastened firmly against her forehead. She is dressed in a layered outfit that has bits of ice stuck to it in places - she had to have been in the snow outside. "Weavile, you're awake! I hope you feel alright. Look what I found outside."

On the bed lay a strange looking pokemon. You could only see it's head because it was wrapped up in blankets. It's face was blue and seemed to be sleeping. Sitting on it's head was a yellow thing that resembled a work helmet. A red jewel was stuck precisely between it's shut eyes.

"I've never seen anything like it." She says again. The little boy who stood next to her agreed, then said; "When it wakes up, do you think it can stay with us?"
"I don't know." The girl admitted. The boy looked pained.
"Awww, please, Eden?" But she only repeated her previous answer.

"I think we should go get some help for it though." She dug out a pokeball. It popped open and Prinplup appeared. "C'mon let's go see Candice in Snowpoint and see if she can help."

"Hehehe. You didn't think I'd be defeated that easily, did you?" he says in a mocking manner.

"GET OFF!!!" you yell. You were so close.
13522222111111.title: Here goes something...

choices: Gallade comes up with an idea.
Gardevoir comes up with an idea
135222221111111.content:
You give chase without a single thought. You need to try and get Ralts back.
HEY!!! She turns to you with a satisfied smirk crawling across her face. Get back here!!!

She continues to smirk. Turning away, you see her mouth something. You squint your eyes and try to sharpen your hearing to try and here what she is saying.

It doesn't take you long to figure out what she said. Gengar appears right in front of you this time, but he's not trying to stop you in your tracks. Instead, he is floating backwards at the same pace you are running forwards. He seems to be enjoying your frustration.

"I promise you, I will get Ralts back! And I will make you and your trainer regret---" you push through gritted teeth.

"Never make a promise you know you can't keep my friend. We have our ways of remaining hidden." he ended with the usual Gengar laugh. But not for the reasons you thought. You look down to see that a Shadow Ball is forming in Gengar's hands.

He fires it at you from point-blank range, it hits you right in the stomach. You gasp as it digs into your body, trying to regain the breath that has just escaped. The last thing you h is hear is Gengar laughing before you pass out.

You wake up to find you are in Gardevoir's arms. Tears flowing down her face in streams. She pulls you into a hug as soon has you open your eyes. "Thank Arceus you're OK." she manages to squeeze out. "I wouldn't have been able to deal with losing both of you at once."

You manage to break away from her and stand up. You turn and start walking. "Gardevoir, I'm sorry. I tried to stop them and I failed." you stop in your tracks. Gardevoir has put a hand on your shoulder.

"You tried at least Gallade. But now we need to---" she tries to reassure you.

A sudden spark shoots of in your head. "Where is the male human? He will know where the other one's going."

Gardevoir hangs her head. "Gengar came back and retrieved him after you collapsed." You slice through the tree next to you in a blind rage.

"So what do we do know?"
135222221111111.title: What to do?

choices: You end up on Route 224. It's going smoothly.
You end up in Snowpoint City. Things got more comlicated.
1352222211111111.content:
You get an idea, but you are not sure if Gardevoir is going to go along with it. You need her help however, if this is going to work.

"Gardevoir, I'm going to need your help to get Ralts back. And you're going to need to trust what I'm going to do. Do you understand?" still with tears in her eyes, she gives you a weak nod. "Are you able to use Teleport?" again, a weak nod. "OK then." you turn and face her and put your hands on her shoulders. "I'm going to need you to take us to Route 224."

Gardevoir gives you a look of shock as soon as you mention where it is you need to go.
"But... I've never travelled a distance like that before."

"Well there is a first time for everything." you know your efforts to cheer her up won't work, but you can still try. You soften your voice to speak to her this time. "Look, I know I'm asking a lot from you, but if we're going to get Ralts back, I'm going to need you to try."

Gardevoir hangs her head and turns away from you. She seems to be thinking in over. You can't blame her really. A mother does what she thinks is best for her child, even when it may put her in danger herself. With this Ralts being shiny also, you can guarantee that there will be a lot of trouble ahead.

She turns back to you and gives you her answer.
"Alright, I will try my best. Lets go."

You smile at her, she smiles back. You put your arms around her and hug her. She returns it. You look at your arm as it slowly begins to disappear. Then, everything goes black. Where you end up now is out of your control. You just hope Gardevoir has enough confidence in her abilities to get you where you need to be. You have every confidence she can do it. She's had her powers all her life, you've only had yours for the day.
1352222211111111.title: We need help.

choices: He speaks with a calm, yet annoied voice. He wants answers.
He's outraged at you trespassing and sends you away!
13522222111111111.content:
You feel ground beneath your feet once more. You slowly open your eyes, it takes a short while for them to adjust. You look around and take in the scenery, a smile creeps over your face when you see where you are. Route 224. You look at Gardevoir, who is still holding onto you, with both her eyes shut tight.

"Gardevoir, you can open up your eyes now." you say in a calm encouraging voice.
"I can't, I don't want to see where we've appeared because of me." her voice sounds like she is almost choking on her own words.
"There is no need to worry. We are exactly where we need to be." you continue to talk in a soft voice. Her eyes fly open, she lets go of you and she instantly looks at the area around her as if it was the most beautiful sight she had ever seen. "You did it. Well done." she turns back to you and gives you a hug so big it could put a Groudon to shame. "We need to get going." you finish off.

You walk up to a cave in the side of a cliff, with Gardevoir following close at your side. The cave is pitch-black, almost as if light is just absorbed into the emptiness. Gardevoir is feeling uneasy about this whole thing now. She jumps when you start speaking.
"Is anybody in there? Come on out." you call into the cave. Two yellow, what-seem-to-be, eyes appear in the depths of the cave. A yellow zig-zagged mouth appears below and a red dot appears centrally above the eyes. A dark, low, reverbed voice answers back from the cave.
"You have no business here. Leave at once." Gardevoir almost fainted from shock.
"Let's go now. Please, I'm scared." she says to you with big eyes.
"Don't worry. I know what I'm doing." you say back to her with confidence.
Those eyes still staring out from the cave.

"Come on out so we can talk face-to-face, Dusknoir!" you call in. Gardevoir freezes when she hears the name you called. She turns to you almost enraged if she wasn't still scared.
"You came here to talk with a Dusknoir?!?! Haven't you heard about them!? It's a reaper. It take souls to the spirit world. You know, dead!

"Yes, I've heard the stories. But that is only half. HE also guides those whose souls are lost back home." you reply. Voice still calm.
The red and yellow objects disappear in the depths. You notice, but Gardevoir is unaware.
"I can't believe you would be so---"
Two arms are thrusted towards you and, before you can react, you both are caught in each one, in an incredibly tight grip. Dusknoir emerges from the shadows and moves slowly towards you two. He towers at a height of 7'03". He raises you both so that you are level with his face. Now you and Gardevoir both stare into his red eye.
13522222111111111.title: Who's that Pokémon?

choices: He waits with them until they awake.
He sends them away so they are safe from him.
135222221111111111.content:
"How did you know who I was?" Dusknoir spoke in his low, dark, reverbed voice once more.
"Come on Dusknoir. I've known about this place for ages." it is difficult for you to reply as Dusknoir has you in a crushing grip. Dusknoir's eye flares up.
"Then my trust has been betrayed!" he roars. "Only one has ever known about this place and I trusted him enough to let him walk away with this secret!" it suddenly clicked. You had forgotten you were a Gallade, therefore Dusknoir did not recognise you. You struggle to talk back to him.
"No, wait Dusknoir. It's me! I have not betrayed your trust. I have held your secret very close." hoping to convince him.
"The one I trusted was human. Not a Gallade." he replies in a calmer voice.
"It's me Dusknoir! I was that human." you're getting worried now. It doesn't seem to be convincing him and his grip is getting tighter. Gardevoir seems to be passing out.

"Then let me ask you this. Only the one who has been here before should know the answer." His gaze is fixed on you. You are finding it hard to stay conscious. He asks you what he wants to know. "What is it that a Dusknoir needs to be a Dusknoir? What is it that a Dusknoir uses that no other pokémon can? And what is it that a Dusknoir possesses that allows him to travel between the real and spirit world?"

You struggle to respond before you pass out. Gardevoir has long passed out and you are well on your way.
You have very little capabilities left. You push out you final words before you fall unconscious. Your voice has just fallen to a gasp.
"The item... you are referring to... is the Reaper Cloth." With those words, your sight blacks out and you fall unconscious.

Dusknoir shows signs of surprise as you called out 'Reaper Cloth'. He suddenly realised that you spoke the truth and immediately released his grip on both you and Gardevoir. He now understood that he was wrong and he has unjustly harmed two innocents. A Dusknoir is bound by a code as they take up their duty as the reaper. A code only known by a Dusknoir. One that is not permitted to be heard by any other pokémon and so they must accept what others think of them. The code is as follows:
A Dusknoir must only take those whose time has come.
A Dusknoir is not permitted, under any circumstances, to harm a soul.
A Dusknoir is only permitted to use non-lethal force if the soul resists. They still must not be harmed.
A Dusknoir must protect the soul until it is safe, in the spirit world.
A Dusknoir, above all, must not harm an innocent. Regardless of how they act towards them. Just leave them.

Dusknoir knew he did wrong. And know knew, he had to set it right.

"Stay away from them. I'd rather die then let someone take my children" The Raichu yells launching a thunderbolt at you. Unable to dodge you raise your arms in front of you a a green shield appears. Knowing you used Protect, and that it doesn't last long, you calmly talk to the Raichu.

"I'm sorry ma'am. I thought you were a human. You see our child has the same condition yours does" You say ushering her to Ralts

Raichu says leading the way and Gardevoir rushing behind her. Against your better instinct you follow them seeing two trainers emerge to the spot you were in. A Skarmory appears standing next to a trainer wearing a red cap with a white feather, a red cape and jacket, white pants, and brown knee high boots. Both of them look to a trainer wearing a black three piece suit and a black fedora who was with a nasty looking Scyther.

The man in black speaks first "Well Blaze, it looks like we missed it again." to which the man in red responds adjusting his cap "I would appear so Umbra. Skarmory, let's head back to Hearthome. We'll come up with something there." Taking both trainers, Skarmory flies off with Scyther at its side.

"This home is lovely" Gardevoir admits watching the children play taking a seat at a large table

"Thank you" Raichu admits. "I had a trainer once who cared for me. On her deathbed she held up a strange disc that taught me how to use Secret Power. Her dying words were 'Take care of yourself. I'll always be with you'. I've been hiding here from the humans"

You sit down looking to Raichu and Gardevoir "Well Gardevoir, we should go"

Raichu immediately springs up "No! You can't Those trainers are still out there. Please at least stay the night."

"Very well Raichu" Gardevoir replies "Thank you for such hospitality"

Time passes and Ralts gains two new friends while Gardevoir and Raichu find kindred spirits in each other. While everyone is asleep you keep watch. You keep a steadfast focus until...

14.title: I'm Normal, But Not Regular

141.content:
You shake to try and wake yourself up, but you only get brown hair all over the floor. You look around. You're in some sort of Mansion, and you just got out of some luxary pokemon bed.

You run up to a mirror. Pointy Ears, brown and white fur, and beady black eyes. You're Eevee. No doubt. This is way too freaky. You scratch your head with one of your new paws and try to adjust to standing on four legs. You hear someone coming.

"Eevee! Ready yet?" A Jolteon, Vaporeon, and Flareon walk into the room.

"Woah!! You're talking to me!" You yell out. Something between a purr and english comes out, but they only notice the english.

"No time for jokes, brother. Master expects you to have evolved by the time he gets back from Hoenn, and you've already taken to long to deicde on your evolution." Vaporeon tells you. Flareon rolls it's eyes and slides three stones toward you.

"I think you should come with us instead." An Umbreon and Espeon walk in the door and look injured from fighting. "If you want to evolve with us by tommorrow, we need to hurry."

You trip in confusion. "What? Huh? Someone Explain this all to me."

"NO TIME!" They all shout out in unision.

Hurry and pick which ones to go with. Umbreon and Espeon, Or Jolteon,Flareon, and Vaporeon
141.title: Eevee Evolution Crisis?

1411.content:
You slowly follow behind brother Umbreon, and Sister Espeon, despite thier constant urges to hurry. Soon you get to a cross in the hallway. "Brother..." Espeon says to Umbreon. "If we wait untill morning to have Eevee evolve, he won't make it in time. We'll have one, maybe two hours to train. It can't be done. You should just start training him."

"No sister, this decision will affect the rest of his life. Convienience is no excuse to make the choice for him." Umbreon looks over at you. They both expect you to chose the other one. Your whole life? You haven't even figured out why you're an Eevee, you don't plan on spending your whole life this way.

Might as well chose.
1411.title: Easy Night or Hard Morning

"Ok, here's our options," he says. "We can either do the agilty course which will get you to an Umbreon faster, but you will be weaker, or you can pull this huge log by the harness. It will take longer, but you will be stronger. So what will it be?"

14111121.content:
You stare at your new reflection. You now have thick black fur all over your body and yellow bands around your ears and tail as well as a yellow circle on your forehead and legs.
The Umbreon and the Espeon you saw earlier enter the room.

"Good, you've evolved. That agility course was a little too much for you, we dragged you back into bed after you fainted and I guess you must have evolved over night." the Umbreon tells you.

"So, now that I've evolved could anyone explain to me where I am?" you ask.

"What do you mean?" the Espeon asks, sounding a little confused.

"Well, this might sound crazy, but... I was a human, and when I woke up yesterday I was here... as an Eevee..." you stammer.

"What? That's crazy! You've lived here all your life." the Espeon replies.

"No I haven't! Please, I'm scared, tell me what's happening!" you cry.

"We'll try to help you but right now we need to get ready, Master will be coming back soon."
14111121.title: You're an Umbreon!

choices: Same, lavish bed, all of your siblings are staring at you.
The foot of a person's bed, middle class, you are still an Umbreon.
141111212.content:
"Ok. Ummm. No. I'm going back to bed and try to get things back to normal and see if this is just some messed up dream. Good. Uhh." You look towards the window to guess at what time it actually is.

"Good afternoon gentle, uhh Mon? I'm going back to my own reality. Good bye." You say before laying back down and falling back asleep.

Whilst asleep, you have nightmarish dreams where you didn't change back into a human. Constant and painful battles against other pokemon that are much larger and stronger than you fill your subconscience. After being deemed worthless by your "master" you are thrown out on the streets to fend for yourself. Three months pass in an instant and you find yourself hiding in tall, near neon green grass from a trainer you spotted walking into your area. You are tripped over by that trainer, upon regaining its composure, the trainer throws out a pokemon from that dreaded capsule you believe to have been dodging for three months now.

Having been backed up against a rock, the trainers Pokemon picks you up and smashes you through the obstacle blocking your escape. Holding on to your last threads holding you to conscientiousness, you barely dodge a Ultraball that was thrown through the dust from the impact. Full of adrenaline, you dart off in the opposite direction of the trainer only run into a brick wall.

You run left to try and find a way out and find a wooden door along the way. Another poke ball comes out of nowhere, missing you and slamming into the door. The door opens and you run inside, trying to get away from the trigger happy trainer. You run to the opposite end of the room, but when you look back, each and every person in the home has a poke ball out, ready to release at you. A hoard of pokeballs are hurled towards you. A poke ball hits you square in the forehead, your head jerks back and everything goes black.

Where do you awaken?

The scene portrayed above is not a set storyline, you may follow the one portrayed in this chapter, but I recommend against it. I want to see at least some hint of creativity here and hope that no-one elaborates upon this. I will not even be embellishing this myself any further. Also, if your location is unable to be changed, Mr. Or Mrs. Divine Bandit, if you are reading this, change the choices below if you wish.
=End Note=
141111212.title: I need to sleep this off.

choices: Go outside and see what you can do out there
1411112122.content:
You were jolted awake from your nightmares when the sun was just peaking over the horizon. "Ugh. Oh. It was just a nightmare. I'm fine. Where am I now?" You look around to get a better grasp on your surroundings. You seem to be in a medium sized room. Much smaller than the one you fell asleep in. You also seem to be at the foot of someone's bed and by the looks of the surrounding walls, a teenage girls bed.

You stand up. Or at least attempt to stand up but stumble and fall back down onto your stomach. "Brilliant. Can't even walk right anymore." You think to yourself. You eventually gain control of your balance and begin to walk around the room. It was a very tidy room. Shelves filled with books and collectibles, a very expensive looking computer in the far corner, a TV with a Playstation 4 and a set-top box (cable box) hooked up to it, a desk with thick books and a shiny silver lamp resting motionless on top of it, and a closed closet in the corner opposite the computer. The, what you believed to be, girl began to stir around a bit. Naturally, you quickly ran back to the bed and jumped back to where you fell asleep at. You closed your eyes, not knowing if she was truly awake or not.

You hear more stirring and a loud yawn before this person's voice came out of his or her mouth in a soothing tone. "Hey there Umbreon, I know you're awake so there isn't any point in pretending you aren't." It was a girl. She sounded nice enough so you opened one eye and returned her gaze. "There's my little patch of darkness. Did you sleep good?" Her tone didn't change but she began stroking your head. After a second you nod back at her. "Great! Now come on, let's go get some breakfast." She said, carrying you along with her.

When the two of you arrived at the kitchen, she set you down and who you assumed to be the girls mother was at the stove cooking breakfast. "Hey mom." The girl said. "Whatcha cookin'?" "Oh, just some scrambled eggs and bacon sweetheart. Get your Umbreon some food then sit down and I'll dish some up for you." The girls mom replied. "Ok, c'mon Sable, let's get you some food." She said, motioning for you to follow her. Sable? Was that her name for you? Whatever, it doesn't matter, you were starving. She grabbed a blue, black speckled fruit out of the fridge and cut it up, took out the seed, put it into a bowl, and slid it over to you. "Eat up." The girl said before sitting down at the table and beginning to eat her own food.

The fruit in the bowl before you didn't smell bad, in fact, it smelled sweet. "C'mon, it's Oran berry, your favorite." She says, noticing you haven't eaten yet. You took a nibble, It tasted delicious. You immediately begin to stuff your face with the blue fruit until there is none left. "Oh well weren't you hungry?" She sounded surprised. She went into the kitchen, put her dishes in the sink, and began to walk back down the hall. "Sable. C'mon." She said, motioning for you to follow her once more. The two of you went back to her room and she shut the door when you arrived. She opened up her closet and she seemed to be getting dressed in her day clothes. Once she was dressed. She said to herself "What to do now..."

141111222.title: Mysterious Person

choices: A Pokemon professor working on all kinds of research and inventions
An incredibly wealthy family intent on spoiling you rotten
1411112221.content:
You turn from the mirror towards the now open door to your room. The door frame is darkened by an imposing figure, silhouetted by the bright light streaming in from the hallway behind them. At first the figure seems unnaturally tall, however you quickly realize that's more due to how small you are now relative to your former height as a human. You guess any adult human would appear imposing to a Pokemon less than one foot tall.

“Hmm... still an Eevee I see...” the figure mutters in a low masculine voice, while taking a step into the room. As he moves closer you can make out more of his features; a young man wearing a red jacket and cap with the Pokemon league insignia embroidered on them. He's clearly a Pokemon trainer; could this be the master the others hand spoken of earlier? The trainer looks you over with a sour expression and sighs. “I was hopping to have another Espeon or Umbreon for next month's tournament. Maybe I was expecting too much from such a tiny Eevee,” he says placing a hand on his forehead, unable to hide his disappointment.

You shrink back under his gaze, your ears folding back instinctively. “It's not my fault...” you squeak, though all the trainer hears is a faint “Eevee...” You didn't chose to be a 'tiny' Eevee; you just found yourself here.

You weren't a Pokemon expert when you were human, but you seem to recall Eevee only evolved into Umbreon or Espeon when they were very happy or with someone they were friends with. After the day you had yesterday, suddenly turning into a Pokemon and then running a marathon in the agility course, followed by a fitful and restless sleep, you weren't exactly the happiest you've ever been. And as for being friends with this trainer? Well, he certainly hadn't made the best first impression.

Before either of you could say anything else, a faint chime begins sounding from the Pokegear on the trainer's left wrist. The trainer taps the device twice and answers the call, his responses punctuated by long pauses when the caller you cannot hear speaks

“Hello...
...Yes
...No, not any more, I-
...A trade?
...Well I do have an Eevee, but-
...Really?
...Well alright then. We'll be right there.”

The trainer taps the Pokegear one more and then turns his attention back to you.

“Well little Eevee, it looks like you'll be getting a new owner,” he says, smiling for the first time since you met him. “I've just arranged the trade and we'll be leaving right away. You're new trainer is going to be...”
1411112221.title: Disappointed

choices: One of the eeveelutions has stowed away to stop the trade!
14111122212.content:
“...A wealthy family. Looks like you and me both lucked out,” the trainer says, smiling for the first time since you met him. “It seems Mr. Lockwood wants a Pokemon for his kid and you fit the bill. Lets get going.”

Before you can react, your trainer scoops you up in his arms and starts carrying you through his home. You briefly consider trying to struggle your way out of his arms, but you quickly suppress that urge. Even if you got away, you'd likely end up facing the other eeveelutions and you knew that wasn't a fight you could win. Plus the others seemed to talk rather highly of this trainer. Perhaps they had seen a side of him you hadn't yet.

Once outside, you were placed in the passenger side seat of a small car. You wondered why you were being transported this way. Didn't most trainers keep their Pokemon in Pokeballs? Did you even have a Pokeball?

Your trainer slides into the drivers seat and the car begins traveling down the road. “The Lockwood family moved here from Kalos 10 or 15 years ago,” He says, presumably to you, though his attention seems fixed on the road before him. “They say Mr. Lockwood throws around more money daily than most people see in a lifetime. I've never met the man, though I've dealt with his butler.”

You zone out as you watch the trees and rolling hillsides passing by the car. The journey seems to take forever, but you do eventually arrive at your destination.

The car begins climbing a large hill surrounded by a dense forest. At the top of the hill is a structure the likes of which you have never seen. A huge manor at least four stories high sits atop the hill, surrounded by a complex of smaller buildings. The expansive yard around them looks like it has been heavily landscaped, with fountains, lush green gardens, topiary and statues carved to look like Pokemon and people.

At the end of the road you can see a man standing in front of the entrance gate. The man is wearing a navy dinner jacket and has a curly mustache. He seems to be awaiting your arrival.

Your trainer stops the car. He opens the door to the car and...
14111122212.title: A Castle on a Hill

choices: Go with Jeeves to the manor
Make a break for the forest
141111222121.content:
“How's it going Jeeves?” Your trainer says, sliding out of the car and waving to the well dressed man.

“Do you have the Pokemon, Mr. Grady?” Jeeves asks in a dull monotone. “I trust you are not wasting Master Lockwood's time.”

“Easy there, Jeeves,” your trainer responds, casually walking around to the car and opening the passenger side door. “Eevee is right here” You hop down to the ground and find yourself standing before Jeeves. The man observes you for a long moment, his stoic expression unchanging save for raising an eyebrow.

“This Eevee is rather small-”

“Relax,” Grady interrupted, “This Eevee is still young. It's father was a Rhydon and the breeder told me there was a Hippowdon and Snorlax somewhere way back in it's family tree. You treat this Eevee well and it will grow into a big Pokemon for sure. I just don't have the time to spare. Now are we doing this trade or what?”

Your head is spinning. A Rhydon and an Eevee? Hippowdon and Snorlax? How was that even possible? Pokemon breeding was really strange. Your transformation into a Pokemon now seemed more complicated than you had ever imagined.

Before you can contemplate your strange linage any further, Jeeves withdraws a Pokeball from his jacket and summons forth a Pokemon. In a flash, a dark-purple squid-like Pokemon appears. Its long body is covered with yellow almost glowing stripes and just looking at it gives you an uneasy feeling.

“Malamar. A Dark and Psychic Type,” your trainer says to no one in particular. “Now I won't need to choose between Umbreon and Espeon. Alright Jeeves, let's do this.”

Just as quickly as it arrived, the Malamar is returned to its Pokeball. Jeeves and Grady shake hands and after a curt nod, Jeeves gives the Pokeball to your former Trainer.

“Alright!” Grady says smiling widely “A pleasure doing business with you. Give Mr. Lockwood my best.” He hurries over to the car. “Good bye! Take good care of Eevee!” Grady calls as he hops in his car and drives away. You are left standing with Jeeves as you both watch the car disappear from view down the hill.

You see Jeeves looking down at you and beckoning you to follow him through the gate. You also notice the treeline is not that far away. You could go with Jeeves and see what this Lockwood Manor is all about. Alternatively, you might be able to escape into the forest if you start running now.
141111222121.title: The Trade

1411112221211.content:
You ultimately decide to follow Jeeves. While you are certain you could make it to the forest before Jeeves could, given most quadrupeds are faster than bipeds, you suspect Jeeves has more Pokemon up his sleeve, (quite literally). After the unsettling encounter with Malamar, you weren't interested in seeing what other powerful Pokemon the Lockwoods might have.

You follow Jeeves though the front gate towards the Manor. Two life size stone statues of Gyarados and Steelix flank the cobblestone path leading up to the Mansion's front door. You can see other statues of Lugia, Dialga and Reshiram further into the gardens that seem to extend out all around the complex. The front porch of the mansion is lined with ornate Corinthian columns and on the roof above stands a statue of Arceus looking down on all who enter the building.

Jeeves quickly ushers you into the large foyer and begins leading you through the mansion. You are hardly given a chance to marvel at the elaborate tapestries, ornate molding, exotic artwork and rich carpets of the mansion's rooms as you are led from one into another equally stunning.

After walking through what seems like a blur of golds, reds and bronzes, you find Jeeves has brought you to a mahogany door at the end of a long hall. He knocks 3 times and steps back, waiting patiently. You hear string from beyond the door and a short moment later the door opens revealing...
1411112221211.title: Your New Trainer

choices: Wait a while and see what life as an Eevee is like
14111122212111.content:
The door opens revealing a young girl. She wears a simple blue dress and has long brown hair. She regards Jeeves with a curious expression.

Jeeves bows. “Lady Cassandra, I bring news from Master Lockwood.” You see the girl's face darken at the mention of Lockwood's name. It seems Jeeves notice's this as well, as he hastily continues. “Your father regrets being unable to attend your tenth birthday party last week. He has arranged for me to give you this belated birthday gift and hopes you will accept his most heartfelt apologies.” Jeeves gestures down to you. “I present you with your very own Pokemon, Eevee.”

You watch the girl's expression change from one of sadness to confusion until she looks down and locks eyes with you. A wide smile forms on her face and she scoops you up in her arms.

“Wow! My very own Pokemon? This is great!” Cassandra shouts squeezing you tightly, causing you to let out a little squeak.

Jeeves bows again, looking visibly relieved. “Congratulations, My Lady. I will now take my leave. Do not hesitate to call should you need anything.” With that, he turns and disappears down the hall.

The girl puts you back onto the floor and crouches down to your level. “Hi there, Eevee! My name is Cassandra, but my parents call me Cassie. Pleased to meet you!”

You try to respond hello, though a single “Eevee.” is all that can be heard. Cassandra giggles.

“Your so cute! What should we do first?” Your new trainer pauses in thought a moment and suddenly exclaims “Let me show you around your new home!”

Cassandra leads you on a whirlwind tour of the Lockwood estate. Some of the highlights include a massive multi-level library, a fully stocked infirmary, a hair-styling and grooming salon and a full size theater. You are surprised by the fact most of these facilities appear to be manned by the manors waitstaff. You also notice many of the doors seem to have large pet doors built into their lower halves. When Cassandra see you looking at them she explains her father had them installed for a Luxray he once owned.

Cassandra finished the tour by leading you through a large kitchen. At the back of the room stands another door. “This is the pantry,” your trainer explains while flipping a couple of latches and bolts around the edges. “It's stocked full of Pokemon food for when my dad's Pokemon visit. We usually leave it locked up to keep Chester out when he's here.” She opens the door revealing a massive room filled with crates and canisters and walls lined with cabinets and containers. Appetizing aromas waft from all directions and you find your mouth watering.

“Hungry?” Cassandra asks. Before you can respond, your tummy answers for you, letting out a low growl. Your trainer giggles and fills a small dish from a dispenser. She places the dish in front of you and you take a small bite. Whatever this is, it's the best thing you've tasted since becoming a Pokemon. It's also the only thing you've tasted since your transformation, so you quickly devour the bowls contents. Cassandra smiles “I'll leave the pet door unlocked in case you get hungry again.

“Lady Cassandra,” You hear one of the waitstaff in the kitchen call, “It's getting late, my child. Shouldn't you and Eevee retire for the night?”

Your trainer looks to her watch and sighs, “I guess it is getting late. Come on Eevee.” and with that she picks you up and carries you back to her room. “You can go wherever you like when I'm not around,” She says as you travel down the hall. “If you get lost, one of the staff will be able to help you find me.”

Unlike the lavishly decorated halls of the rest of the manor, Cassandra's room looked like a normal kid's room, with a simple bed, desk and a number of Pokemon plushies. Your trainer set you down on a life-size Snorlax cushion. “I can't wait to play with you some more.” she says before she goes to bed. “Good night, Eevee.”

As you lay on the comfy cushion you contemplate everything that has happened today. Your situation has been drastically improved in the past twelve hours, at least by your estimation. You doubt you would have had this level of autonomy with your previous trainer. Your thoughts turn to the question of what to do next. With the ability to move around the property at your leisure, you might be able to start your own investigation into how you became a Pokemon. There was a library full of books which might hold clues to reversing the process. You then think about your new trainer. Cassandra seems like a nice enough kid. Maybe you should try living as an Eevee for a while and see what it's like. The library isn't going anywhere if you change your mind. As you drift off to sleep you decide to...
14111122212111.title: First Impressions

choices: Jeeves arrives with some distressing news
141111222121112.content:
You decide to give your new trainer a chance and see if you like life as an Eevee, though, your decision may have been colored by a desire to see how the the ultra rich lived, (and maybe indulge a bit yourself). Unfortunately, your first few days were a little rocky.

While you had managed to get walking as a quadruped down pretty quickly after your transformation, walking down stairs was a whole other matter entirely. There was just something weird about having your tail-end at a higher level than your head while moving down stairs. That disorientation resulted in a few unceremonious face-plants, which fortunately only damaged your pride, and evoked a few giggles from Cassandra. You did eventually get it down and could now race down stairs with the best of them.

You also learned to be more mindful of things that had been inconsequential to you as a human. Nothing brought this point home quite as acutely as when you stumbled into a burdock plant while playing with Cassandra on your second day together. You quickly discovered it was much more... inconvenient to remove burrs from your fur than it had been to pull them out of your socks.

Despite the rough start, you quickly settle into a routine. Cassandra wakes you up every morning, (often earlier than you would like), and takes you down to the kitchen where there is a meal waiting for you. After breakfast, Cassandra meets up with her tutor, and they spend the next few hours in the library. You had accompanied your trainer there a few times, but you found your presence tended to distract her from her lessons, so you usually spend the time napping or exploring the manor.

Around noon you reunite with Cassandra and, after lunch, the two of you spend the afternoon together. From simply reading or brushing your fur, to running races and playing pranks, Cassandra always had some activity she wanted to do with you. She never forced you to do anything you didn't want to do, though it was hard to say no to her puppy dog eyes, so you did find yourself completely covered with bows or drenched from playing catch in the rain on more than one occasion.

After dinner, Cassandra reviews her lessons for the day and you usually rest and recover from the crazy antics you participated in during the afternoon, and preparing for the next days activities.

One activity you found yourself enjoying more than you thought you would was Pokemon battling. Every few days you and Cassandra would take on some of the wild Pokemon in the tall grass on the edge of the manor grounds. It became apparent early on that your trainer didn't know much about Pokemon battling. Nothing underscored this fact more than when you were knocked out by a Nidoran ♀'s Poison Sting and Double Kick, after being ordered to preform your third consecutive Tail Whip. Eventually, you and Cassandra find your rhythm. Your trainer tells you how she wants you to fight, (Offensively, Defensively, etc...), and gives you the freedom to choose which moves you feel would best suit that style. In this way you are given more flexibility to quickly adapt to your opponent and Cassandra is able to observe how different moves work in different situations. You are Swift enough to Take Down most wild Pokemon with ease and the two of you become the bane of Pidgey and Rattatas throughout the yard.

But perhaps the thing you enjoy the most about living at the Lockwood manor is the food. There are roast, grill and pastry chefs as well as several sous chefs on the manor staff and the works they create can bring a tear to your eye. The end of every meal leaves you eagerly awaiting the new and wonderful flavors of the next. Also, Cassandra and many of the staff carried a number of Pokepuffs with them and it didn't take much of an excuse for them to give you one or two.

After a couple of months you have come to the conclusion that you rather like your new life as an Eevee. While being a Pokemon wasn't without its drawbacks, you decide the pros far outweigh the cons at this stage. You enjoy your time spent with your trainer until...
141111222121112.title: The Princess and the Eevee

choices: Smaller or the same size as you are
1411112221211121.content:
“There, I bet that feels better,” Cassandra says, running the brush through your fur one last time before placing it on the table next to her chair.

“You have no idea.” Your response comes out as a relieved sounding “Eevee,” causing your trainer to giggle a little. You hop down from her lap, where she had been brushing you for the past thirty minutes, and she rises to her feet. As winter approaches your fur seems to be getting thicker and you were getting itchy as the new hairs grew in underneath your existing fur. Fortunately, Cassandra seemed to pick up on this and had been brushing you more frequently.

“Hopefully, your winter coat is all grown in now.” Cassandra says, and then turns to look out the window. “We should get out there and see if we can find any new Pokemon while the sun is still high.”

While your trainer grabs her jacket and a gloves, you take a moment to admire yourself in the room's full length mirror. In the past 3 months your height had almost doubled, putting you close to two feet tall. Back when you were human, you seemed to remember reading that Eevees typically didn't get much taller than one foot and you wondered why you were different. Perhaps it had something to do with the lineage your former trainer had alluded to when he traded you, or perhaps all Eevees eventually grew this big and no one knew, since they were always evolving them so quickly. You can see the hair of your furry collar and tail are looking longer than they were in the height of summer, and the rest of your coat appears a bit fluffier, particularly around your midsection. Before you can further indulge your vanity, you hear your Cassandra calling

“Come on Eevee, let's go!” your trainer says, heading towards the door, so you quickly fall in-line behind her. The two of you are met by the brisk autumn air as you exit the mansion and make your way to the forest at the edge of the manor grounds.

In recent days, Cassandra has begun catching Pokemon. While she is certainly not an all-star pitcher, her throw and aim have already improved greatly. With your help, she already has three confirmed catches, two Rattata and a Nidoran ♂. Jeeves had made it quite clear from the start that Mr. Lockwood did not want his “estate turned into a Pokemon zoo,” so Cassandra has released all the Pokemon she's caught so far. She's told you she's only going to keep Pokemon that are “really special.” You are not really sure how she's defining 'special'. Perhaps you'll know it when you see it.

Suddenly you hear movement in the woods ahead of you. You share a quick glance with Cassandra who nods, confirming she's heard it too. Something is coming towards you, from inside the forest. You can tell by the rustling and snapping of twigs that this Pokemon is...
1411112221211121.title: A New Challenger Approaches

14111122212111212.content:
Based on the the sound it makes moving through the underbrush, you figure the Pokemon would have to be pretty light on it's feet to be much bigger than you are. You steel your self, preparing for the encounter. As the unseen Pokemon gets closer your heart rate increases and you can feel the hairs on your back standing up, making you look even fluffier.

The Pokemon emerges into the clearing at the edge of the forest, revealing...
14111122212111212.title: Size Matters Not

choices: The infirmary. The doctor should be able to treat Pokemon as easily as humans.
The store room which has a number of supplies like Potions and Full Heals.
141111222121112121.content:
A reddish-brown Pokemon jumps out of the woods at the other end of the clearing. The quadrupedal Pokemon's sharp fox-like features and six curly tails give it's identity away as a Vulpix. You can almost feel the sunlight turning harsh as the Pokemon approaches. The sun's bright warming rays are a sharp contrast to the cool autumn air all around you.

“A Vulpix! Let's try and catch it!” Cassandra calls excitedly behind you.

You nod to your trainer and begin charging towards Vulpix. You move swiftly, closing the distance between you and your target. The Pokemon doesn't seem to react to your advance. She stands her ground and stares at you intently. Vulpix's big brown eyes turn a milky white color and they take on pale glow.

Before you realize what's happening, you are hit with a series of flashing lights that seem to overload your senses. Your vision blurs and you to loose sight of your target. You can hear your trainer shouting behind you, but her words are unintelligible. The disorientation causes you to lose your balance and you trip over your own feet, crashing painfully into the ground.

You struggle back to your feet, when a sudden impact almost knocks you off of them again. It feels as if a ball of fire has just struck your left side. You feel the singeing of your fur and the flames licking across the now exposed skin of your back, as small Embers rain down from the ground from your burning coat.

The sudden searing pain is enough to bring you back to your senses and you snap out of your confusion. 'Confuse Ray!' you think to yourself. You had forgotten Vulpix could learn that move and it had almost cost you the battle. You catch sight of your opponent once more and drop into a defensive stance.

“Eevee, are you alright?!” Cassandra shouts, clearly worried. “Maybe we should fall back...”

“I've got this!” you shout back as a resolved sounding “Eevee! Eevee!” while keeping your eyes locked on your opponent. The two of you being slowly circling each other along the edge of the clearing.

“Are you sure you're OK?” Your trainer calls again, obviously unconvinced. You frown. Your burn must look pretty bad. As you wonder if you dare take your eyes off your opponent long enough to reassure your trainer, you have and idea.

You turn away from Vulpix towards your trainer and giver her the widest, goofiest grin you can muster and wink. Cassandra's expression shifts from one of worry, to confusion and then back to worry, as she watches Vulpix take advantage of the opening you've given her by turning away.

Vulpix shoots like lightning across the field, and in an instant slams into your exposed flank. You, however, anticipate the Quick Attack and instead of bracing for it, you roll with the hit and fall to the ground. Your opponent, clearly expecting more resistance, loses her balance and tumbles over you.

As the two of you roll across the ground, you reach out with with your foreleg and, catching as much dirt and sand with your paw as you can, you fling a Sand Attack at your opponent's face. Vulpix yelps and scrambles back to her feet. She falls back to the edge of the clearing and desperately tries to rub the sand out of her eyes.

“Wow, nice one Eevee!” Cassandra shouts as your get back up to your feet. “Hurry, use Take Down!”

You can't help but smile a little; that's exactly what you were thinking. You need to follow this up quickly or you'll lose your opportunity to strike. You begin darting across the clearing towards your opponent.

Vulpix stops rubbing her eyes at the sound of your approach and fires another Ember in your direction; however, it's clear her accuracy as taken a hit, and you narrowly avoid the projectile. Alarmed, Vulpix starts staring intently at you again, even as you continue to close the distance. You shut your eyes tightly, expecting another Confuse Ray, and run the rest of the distance blind.

Vulpix gasps as you arrive within striking distance and you can hear her starting to move out of the way, but it's too little, too late. You shift your trajectory and leap towards the shuffling sound. You open your eyes just as you slam into the startled looking Vulpix and you Take Down your opponent. The pair of you crash hard into the ground, with Vulpix taking the brunt of the impact. The Pokemon wheezes a little, having had the wind knocked out of her.

Before you can take any further action, you see a red and white object arc through the air above you and strike the weakened Vulpix. In a flash of light the Pokemon vanishes, and in it's place lies the pokeball. The ball shakes and vibrates for several seconds before finally settling, losing it's faint glow and capturing the Pokemon inside.

“We did it!” Cassandra yells running up to you and picking up the pokeball. She kneels down next to you. “Good Job, Eevee! You were amazing!”

You smile back at your trainer. While defeating a Vulpix was hardly a heroic deed, you do take a certain amount of satisfaction in having taken down such a strong opponent. Your chest swells with pride at your trainer's praise. That lasts for all of about five seconds, when the adrenaline from the battle finally wears off and the pain from your wounds and exhaustion come crashing back. You grit your teeth as the pain from your burn assaults your senses once more, and you find it hard to maintain your balance as exhaustion sets in.

Eevee! I'm sorry! We need to get you patched up!” Cassandra says, realizing the extent of your injuries. She scoops you up in her arms and starts carrying you back to the manor. When you arrive back inside out of the cold, your trainer takes you to...
141111222121112121.title: Burning Battlefield

1411112221211121211.content:
“Doctor Brown, you have to help Eevee!”

The graying doctor looks up from the computer he's working on and sighs, gesturing to a lab table in the middle of the infirmary. “How many times have I told you to carry a first aid kit with you when you're out there battling Pokemon?”

“I w-was in such a hurry to get out there before the sun went down-” Cassandra stammers as she sets you down on the table, before being cut off by the doctor.

“Did you at least stop by the store room to get the supplies to treat Eevee?” The doctor says as he crosses the room and begins rummaging through a nearby cabinet, already having guessed the answer.

“Well, no, I just thought...” Cassandra begins before simply hanging her head. “I'm sorry.” she says, hanging her head.

The doctor's statements cause you to scowl. You and Cassandra were never more than a fifteen minute walk from the manor's staffed and stocked medical facility. It seemed cruel to berate a ten year old child for not over preparing when she knew full well there was a safely net close by.

“I'm not the one you should be apologizing to,” the doctor says, returning from the cabinet with a tray of assorted bottles and jars. Setting the tray next to you, he grabs a plain looking purple vial and administer its contents to your left shoulder. You instantly feel your strength returning as the potion's medicine enters your bloodstream. You let out a sigh of relief.

Cassandra leans in close to you. “I'm sorry, Eevee,” she says, the melancholy in her voice is mirrored in her facial expression. You can't bear to see your trainer looking so sad, so you do your best to cheer her up.

“Don't worry about it!” you say, trying to replicate your wide grin from earlier, while placing your paw on her nose. Your happy sounding “Eevee!” and goofy expression seem to have the desired effect and you watch your trainer's face brighten.

“Now to do something about that burn,” the doctor mutters to himself as he unscrews the cap of a small jar of salve. “This may sting a little,” he warns, as he takes a gob from the jar and begins applying it to the singed skin on your back.

As he works, you idly wonder why Dr. Brown was even here. A job in a major city hospital or clinic would surely be a better use of his skills. Perhaps remaining on staff in the at the manor was just his way of stay busy during retirement; (more of the infirmary's space looks to be dedicated to lab equipment than beds or medical supplies), or maybe he tenure here had more to do with a sense of loyalty to the Lockwood family. A significant portion of the manor staff were quite elderly and, from the few conversations you had overheard, held a high opinion of the Lockwoods, so it didn't seem that far fetched.

Whatever the reason, you can't deny his treatments are effective. Moments after applying the salve, the stinging stops and and the skin of your back, (what little you can see looking back), looks as if it had never been burned.

“There, all treated,” Dr. Brown says, putting the cap back on the jar and placing the used items back on the tray. “Just try not to scratch at it too much as the fur grows back in.”

“You're the Doc, Doc,” you mutter, hopping off of the table. Your response is unintelligible to the doctor, though he doesn't see to be listening to you anyway.

“How exactly did Eevee get burned?” The doctor asked, turning his attention back to Cassandra. “I didn't think there were that many fire types around here.”

“Oh!” Your trainer gasps, having been so worried about your injuries that she had briefly forgotten the events that had led to them. Cassandra reveals the pokeball and holds it high. “We caught a Vulpix!” she beams before another realization dawns on her. “Um, you should probably heal her up too.”

Dr. Brown just shakes his head. “Alright, lets have a look,” he says gesturing to the table once more. Cassandra summons Vulpix from her pokeball and in a flash the Pokemon materializes on the lab table. Once out, Vulpix is...
1411112221211121211.title: A Wonderful Bedside Manner

1411112222.content:
"I was hoping you had not evolved."

You get into a defensive stance.

"Why are you growling at me? I was the one who caught you."

"He is the Master and did he just say what I think he said? He was glad I had not evolved."

"I was hopping to try out a new place I had heard about."

Where is he taking you?
1411112222.title: Say What?

14111122221.content:
He takes you to a dense forest where things are completely different from before.
"Do you see that," Pointing to a rock that is completely covered in moss. "if we train here you may become a completely different Eevee all together. Do you want to run around the forest some or look for some battles?"
14111122221.title: Mossy Stone

141111222212.content:
Right before you decide to give him an answer, a Budew comes out of some grass.

"Eevee use quick attack."

You strike the Budew very hard and it quickly runs.

Do you feel different?
141111222212.title: Let's get ready to rumble.

1411112222122.content: You feel strong, maybe even too strong. Before you know it, the plants begin too look smaller than they were. you feel taller and heavier. It is unexplainable until it stopped. Your masters jaw dropped seeing what you have become.You sprint to some nearby water and see...
1411112222122.title: Evolution

14111122221222.content: Do you see purple fur or a green leaf?
14111122221222.title: Something Else?

141111222212222.content:
A green leaf gets in the way of the water.you try to take it away from your face, but it hurts. Wait this leaf is HURTING when I am pulling on it.

"So those rumors were true."

As he says this he pulls out a red pokedex and focuses the lens on you.

"Leafeon the Verdant Pokemon, the GRASS type evolution of Eevee. Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air."

"This is great Jolteon is going to have a much harder training partner now."

This is going to be harder though since I will be weaker than Flareon and those Flamethrowers.

"Let's see how strong you are."He throws a pokeball. Who comes out?
141111222212222.title: Your new look

choices: You wake up in a Pokemon center with Nurse Joy looking after you (your Glaceon)
14111122222.content:
The guy take you to a freezing area up in some snowy mountain. He set you down in the snow and you start hopping around, even with your fur, its too cold for you.

Nodding to himself, the trainer calls out Flareon, Jolteon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon and Vaporeon.

"Do it." he commands, and the other Evee evolutions nod reluctently. All at once, they attack you! You dart around and avoid the attacks as much as possable, but they still hit you.

Once your too injured to move too far on your own, the trainer calls the others off and back into they're Pokeballs, seeing your bleeding.

"Good, now the only way to keep from dying of hypothermia is to evolve into a Glaceon. This is how I get all my non-stone-triggered-evelution pokemon to evolve."

You rack your brain and remember that Glaceon is a fox-like creature covered in light-blue fur. The fur is actually frozen into sharp quills, but one can't really tell by just looking. Glaceon appears to be wearing a Sherpa cap on its head. Glaceon's ears, two spots on its back, tail end and cap-endings are all rhombus-shaped.

"I'll be back to pick you up next month...assuming you evolve by then." The trainer said and walked off, leaving you to your fate.

With diffulcty, you stand up and try to find some food and shelter.

For weeks, you dig through the snow, looking for anything eatable, the cold stings your injuries and you have to learn to block out the pain. That jerk trainer, left you here to freeze to death. If you survive to become Glaceon, the first thing your doing is freezing him solid for this!

Days later, you hear a voice shout in your direction as a bright light erupts from your body. You hear snow crunching rappidly, heading for you, and someone picks you up.

Was this it? Was this how you were going to die?

The very last thing you see before you black out is a young woman dressed in winter gear with a nurse's hat on...
