14522212.content:
Elecricity erupts from your body, flying into the sky. You lie on the ground, exausted, and smoking from the elecricity. Feeling much better you decide to walk towards a nearby lake, and start to take sip. You instantly spit-take as you see your own reflection, waiting for the ripples in the water to fade away, you hope for it to be nothing. As the water stops moving, you gaze in horror at the reflection of a pichu.

Stranger than that, was that you didn't look like a normal pichu. Your eye's were blue, along with your ears!. Not only that, but it seems that eveything that was supposed to be black was blue.......

**********************

http://lollypopkid.deviantart.com/art/Pi...

A personal pic I made for this story.....

********************

You grabbed an ear, and started playing with it. You thought about how to get out of here and get back home, all the while you played with your ear as it seemed to calm you.
Looking around you notice that you were in a feild of sorts.
"Great, were am I?" You ask yourself.

"I think it came from over here! Hurry up guys!" A young boys voice could be heard from in the woods.
A boy with a hat came charging through the woods towards you, followed by a girl wearing black and pink, and another boy wearing a green vest like shirt.
Startled you start to run, you head for the woods dirrectly behind you. Your body took off so fast you got a whole five feet before crashing to the ground, and running on all fours was very new to you.
"Hey look isn't that a Pichu?" Asked the girl.
"No...It looks more like a Minum, but I can't tell." Said the other boy.
"Well lets catch it and find out!" The boy with the hat said. "Go, Buizel!"
"Wait Ash!" The girl yelled.

A weasle-like pokemon came out and got ready to attack you.
"Buizel, Aqua-jet!"
The weasle jumped at you aand water formed around it. It tackled you and you flew through the air, landing next to tree.

I hurt so bad, you were tougher than that, but you couldn't help but cry at the sudden attack.
The weasle backed off with a sad look on it's face, while the girl ran up to you.
She picked you up and craddled you in her arms.
"It's alright, calm down, your not going to get hurt anymore..." She whispered soothingly.
"ASH!!!!!! You should be ashamed of yourself, attacking a deffense-less pokemon, how dare you!" She scolded him.

You found the girl's arm to be quite comfy, but also made you realise that you were also smaller than any other Pichu, youl'd say about half that size. You can fit rather comfortably in one of her arms. She turned to you, and smiled and you melted into her arms. You felt safe in her care.

The boy with the hat came rushing over to you two, he reached out to touch you, saying,"I'm sorry, I just wanted-"
You jumped from the girl's arms and run a couple steps away, befor tripping,.... Again.

"Lets go, it doesn't seem to want us around anymore." The other boy said.
Waving good-bye, the girl turned around to leave with the other two.
Automaticly getting that alone-feeling again, you chase after them. Catching up to them allowed you to get used to slow-running, without falling.
"Wait!" You yell. (Yes, it's still pokemon talk to them!)
They didn't hear you but the Pikachu on the boy's shoulder did, so she got their attention for you. They turned to face you, while you were still a couple feet from them.

*Dramatic run and hug scene*

The boy with the hat got on a knee and opened up his arms, ready for a hug.
You zoomed right by him, and jumped straight for the girl. She caught you, and you nuzzled her affectionatly, If you were going to be stuck like this it might as well be with someone who cares.

"It seems to like you, Dawn!" The other boy said.
She was too busy playing with you to respond, she was trying to tickle you.
"Well?...." She ask through laughing spats, "Do you want to come with us?"
You nodded, as she took out a pokeball, and tapped on your head.
You went without a fight, but there was a problem.....

---------------------------------
'It's dark in here!!!' You yell.
It was pitch black, and you were afraid of the dark.
'Too dark...'
'Get me ot of here!!!' You yell
---------------------------------
You were caught, but the ball was sparking. Dawn backed off, as the ball rolled around sparkling. It popped open, and you shot out. Landing on the ground, you shook off the cramped, darkened feeling you got while in there.
"Whats the matter?" Asked Dawn quizingly, slightly sad. "I thought you wanted to come with me?"
You kick the ball away from you, and looked at Dawn.
"He does, but he soesn't seem to like the pokeball, like Pikachu." Ash said.

"Ok, but how am I going to carry you?"
You answer her question for her, as you hopped on top of her head. Laying down on the top of her beanie, you let out a sigh of releif.

After walking around a little more, Ash said, "Well, he's definetly a Pichu, but why is he blue?"
"Doesn't matter, he's cuter this way." She said with a smile, tickleing you again.
"We should make camp, It's getting dark." Brock said.
"Alright! Everybody out!" They all yelled.
All sorts of Pokemon came blasting out of balls, and you immediatly rush behind Dawn's leg.

"Hey! Who's the new guy?" The giant turtle thing asked.
"Crap.....I know." The weasle from earlier said, "I was forced to battle him earlier, and I'm sorry about that. He made me."
Suddenly a blue penguin popped in front of you.
"Why are you hanging onto her like that?" She asked.
'Too many!' You think as you race up to her head.
"Hey come down here! I want to play!" Some squirrel said.

"Okay, I get it!" Dawn said with a giggle, "Introductions first!"

-------------------------
after the introductions you all had dinner. Then you all talked more, While Pachirisu never let go of you, and nudged you playfully the entire time.
Going to bed, the all were sent into their pokeballs. You laid down under the covers with Dawn and got comfy. She held you close and whispered goodnight into your ear, as the lights went out. Being in the dark again, you squeeked in fright. Dawn understood almost instantly, and brought you even closer to her, in an unyeilding hug.

She once again said,
"Shhhhhh.....It's okay now, nothing will ever hurt you again......"




{Author's note~ Admit it, If you were in this guys shoes you would so want to be a Pichu.}
14522212.title: Dawn....

145222121.content:
"Help!" A voice woke you up...
Some people had rounded up your new friends, and they were calling for help. You quickly woke up Dawn, and she jumped up and ran after them.
Following her, you realize that the other two guys were right behind you. The people who kidnapped your friends, stopped in the middle of a field, and began to say some stupid motto.
Dawn quickly interupted them, and ordered you to use Thunderbolt.
Never actualy practising this, you decided to just push and see what happens...

It came alot easier than you thought it would. Erupting from your body like water from a spout, your next step was to aim. Easier said than done, It was jumping everywhere, but it found it's target, and they felt it. Or so you thought.
"Ha! Lightning rod! Great when dealing with Electric-types." They gloated, as you collapsed to the ground, completly sapped of energy.
Then, Tenticles shot from the side of the machine they were riding on, and grabbed Dawn and the other two.
She screamed and you felt completly helpless.

'Think,what can you do?.....Try anyway and see where that goes.' You thought to yourself.
Standing up, you charge the Machine, running as quickly as possible. You felt the energy inside of you building, as Blue-Lightning began to surround your body. Upon contact with the machine, it sparked, and small explosions were sent throughout the interior. the tentacles let go, and the cage holding your friends fell open.

All in all, you passed out while the machine blew up entirly, and you stared into the fire, wondering how you got into this mess......

1452222222221222.content:
Your tired mind finally registers what your half-closed eyes are seeing on the reflective, test-tube glass. The Legendary Deoxys, who fell from space and was accepted into the Legends by Arceus...according to the stories you had heard. By now, you're awake enough to comprehend some other things.

Like the earlier mentioned test tube, and that the Deoxys was you. You start turning about frantically, unable to take deep breaths due to an insufficient ability to breath. You count instead, which seems to work, and focus on what was happening outside. You float over to the glass, pressing your face and would-be hands against it. There is a group of scientists talking, so you try and hear them through the glass. If you focus, you can hear them easily.

"...It was a success. Congratulations, everybody! We've finally replicated a Legendary Pokemon with near-perfect results. I think this is a far better result then the previous Mewtwo, wouldn't you agree?"

"It was pretty easy, though. After all, we had Mew and Deoxys DNA already. It would have been more challenging if we cloned, say, Raikou. And we even had to use the mind of that kid instead of making one from scratch like we wanted."

"Well, we try that later. We just had to use it to put thoughts into the brain, anyways. No transplant needed. It's body's still self-sustaining at one of our labs, and the longer it's away from it the closer it'll need to be to go back to normal. By the time it finds it's body, it'll have to touch it to go back to human, and that's never going to happen.

"Why are you calling the kid an it..?"

"It's not like I'm talking about a human. It's just a Pokemon now, right? It can't even understand us anymore, I bet. Even if it could, it's far weaker then a simple Tale Pokemon."

You feel bubbling anger. Tale Pokemon were weaker versions of Legendary Pokemon, so you were still pretty strong. You could take them on... The conversation fizzed out as you changed your focus, moving back and swinging your tentacle-like arms. You could see that the scientists had noticed your awakening, but that wasn't important. You start pounding on the glass walls with all your strength, the glass eventually starting to crack. The anger was getting stronger. A scientist calmly pressed a button, and you felt the water change as a sleeping chemical was released. With no time left, the anger overflowed into an attack. You darken several shades, creating a shadow around you. The shadow shoots out towards the scientists as though the glass wasn't there. The scientists, to both your horror and amusement, start screaming in terror. The one calling you an 'it' hits a button in his panic, opening the test tube. You fall to the ground, catching yourself as the water in the tank goes everywhere. You're tired, but the chemical is wearing off. You get up, feeling a bit unstable on your legs. Can you even get out?

Of course you can. You're speed forme, right? They'll never catch you. You start running. They try and catch you, but they would never stand a chance. Eventually you get out, and find yourself far, far away from the lab. Where were you?
1452222222221222.title: Speed Emerald.

The first thing you realize is that you are no longer in your bedroom, your in the middle of a clearing with many small bushes around you, and a lake not too far off in the distance. You next notice this long brown thing coming from your face. It's your beak. You take a quick glance of you body ot figure out what you look like. You say out loud, "Wow! How did I become a Doduo?"

"Don't know bro? I was just asking the same thing myself." said a voice directly next to you. Started, you turn your head to the left, and you find another Doduo head starring back at you. But, thats not all. Looking closer, you realize that this Doduo head is attached to the same body your head is. The other Doduo head must have realized the same thing, because simultaneously, you both try pulling away from each other. Problem is, neither of you realized that you each can only control you side, you the right and the other head the left. Of course, neither of you got anywhere. 14522222222222222212.content:
"You look just as confused about this as I do. Do you have any idea how we ended up like this? The last thing I remember going to sleep in my bed, and then waking up...like this." You begin.

"I-I don't know. I was camping with with a couple of my friends. We all turned in, and then I woke up next to you. Oh and by the way, my name is Ash. What's yours?" Ash replied.

"Well, I...guess it's good to meet you Ash, my name is Matt." You reply.

"Its good to meet you too Matt." Ash smiled.

"Okay, now that we know each other a bit, I think we should head out." You look off in the distance a ways, and you see a town not too far away. You continue, "The Pokemon center I was staying at is not too far away from here. It's this way." You try taking a step forward, but Ash doesn't move.

Ash looks to his left, and says, "My friend's camp is closer, and it is in that direction." Ash pointed with this beak. "I think we should go their first. I'm really worried about my friends and my Pokemon."
14522222222222222212.title: Meeting you other head

"Your not the only one who has Pokemon you know. My Pokemon were with me at the Pokemon Center. Your friends will see your gone, and take care of yours. I need to get to mine to check up on them. So, we need to go this way!" You start pulling toward the city again.

"My camp isn't that far away. We should go to it first!" Ash started pulling in the opposite direction.

"No, this way!" You pulled harder.

"No, this way!" Ash also pulled harder.

"THIS WAY!" You both scream. Neither one of you was getting anywhere. After a few more minutes of arguing, you and Ash both give up. All the pulling put a strain on your body; it was really hurting.

After awhile longer, you finally say, "We obviously won't be getting anywhere if we keep arguing like this. I will go with you to check up on your Pokemon and friends, but we need to go to the Pokemon Center right afterwards, deal."

"Deal!" Ash said happily. He then continued, "And, thanks. I know you must be just as worried."

You smiled at that. "Okay then, lets head out for your camp." Ash took the first step, then you followed, then Ash again. It took you both awhile to perfect the system, but within no time, you both managed to walk somewhat naturally without any falls.

After about 10 minutes, you arrived at Ash's camp.

14522222222222222222222221.content:
You woke up in your tent, today was the beginning of your 3 weeks on this mountain, with your 2 lucarios, Light (female) and Darkness (male) (named for their personalitys). You walked out of your tent to find Darkness starting a fire and Light wearing your hoodie (it was -20 degrees celcius, she was probably cold), then you could hear Light speaking to you.
"Did you sleep well?"
"Uh... sure... . How long was I asleep?"
"2 days" Darkness replied.
"2 days!? How could I have slept that long?.......... and why can I understand you?"
Light started to talk "Well... when you didn't wake up we assumed that you were just tired and went out hiking. When we got back we noticed that you changed in your sleep.. that you were more... like us. Today you were looking exactly like us, so-"
"I had theorized that from spending so much time with us, you had become like us in thought and mind, and today you had taken on our visual characteristics, which had taken 2 days to complete" Darkness finished.
You were stunned by their explaination, so you lifted your paw up to eye level, thouroghly inspecting it, making sure that this wasnt a dream. "ok then... lets confirm this" You lifted your pokedex and set it to identify, then started identifying every visible pokemon to make sure the cold hadnt damaged it. "here goes nothing" You turned the pokedex around and clicked the button.
"Pokemon identification complete: Lucario"
You turned to Darkness and asked him "Darkness...
14522222222222222222222221.title: A frozen morning

choices: Next week (wow you really dont like this storyline im creating)
145222222222222222222222211.content:
...I'm ready to begin training as a Lucario"
Darkness smiled "I hoped you would say that, now lets test your aura skills" He paused for a moment "There are several pokemon in those bushes, identify them and their intentions."
You nodded and closed your eyes, letting your aura explore the area behind the bushes, discovering a glaceon, a cold leafeon, and a dragonair, all of which were lost and afraid, they probably lost their trainer to the cold, unforgiving weather. "They are a glaceon, a leafeon, and a dragonair, all of them want to go home, however they are lost and afraid, thus keeping them in the same area, for their trainer lost his life to the weather"
"Good, that's a little more information than I would have cared to know about, but thats very good for your first try." Darkness replied.
"Well, shouldn't we show them some kindness and let them stay with us?" You asked.
"I like how our trainer thinks" Light said, standing up. "Lets go help them"
You and Light walked up casually to the bushes, when you heard the pokemon say "Be quiet, someone comes" "I hope they are freindly, if we don't get her out of here soon, she'll freeze to death"
Light walked up and parted the bushes "Hello? We're here to help"
"Do you have a camp, we need to get her warm fast" The dragonair said, gesturing to the leafeon. "and do you have a trainer that can take us into their party, we uh... lost ours"
"yes, we have both, now let me carry the leafeon, I can run her to our camp, let our trainer take the pokeballs and lead you to our camp" Light said as she ran off with the leafeon in her arms
"thank you, you're very kind, now where is your trainer? I cant see him anywhere." The dragonair said, looking at you.
"uh... im the trainer... listen, its a long story, i'll tell you when we get to camp"
"ok then..." The dragonair said as he coiled around you. You ran off to your camp with the glaceon following, when you reached your camp, the dragonair exclaimed "ah, fire" just before he uncoiled and slithered off to the fire. You went up to the leafeon and asked Darkness "is she going to be ok?"
"Probably, she needs to keep warm out here so I put her in one of your heavy jackets, and in a while im going to put her into the tent so she doesn't feel so scared when she wakes up" Darkness said as he examined the dragonair for any signs of damage.
145222222222222222222222211.title: A group of frozen pokemon

choices: You use Close Combat (back in the dream)

1452222222222222222222222111.content:
Is it morning already? ... no, I must be dreaming... or am I? Too much to ponder... need more sleep...
You drifted off again.
Wait a minute... I'm not dreaming am I? No, im seeing the Elite 4 battles again... through Darkness's perspective? You saw yourself in an arena, holding a bone rush in your left paw, and readying an aura sphere in the other. "Darkness, distract him with bone rush then launch the sphere at the sand" You heard yourself say. You rushed forwards, the bone rush glowing by the time you brought it down on the Alakazams head, which parried it with Protect, but Protect wasn't efficent when it came to stopping non-attack moves, or sand for that matter. The Alakazam fell, desperately trying to get the sand out of its eyes. You turned around to yourself, looking for a sign that meant "finish him" or "no mercy". you (the one from the memory) flicked your wrist, and you (the real you, actually Darkness in this case) jumped up and started launching aura spheres at the ground around the Alakazam, letting the sand fly up and shield you from view as you prepared to unleash Close Combat...
Meanwhile, back in real life...
"Well, he seems to be having a good rest" The dragonair said, after carefully uncoiling from around you.
"What... where am I..." The Leafeon asked, looking to her friends for an answer.
"You are in a safe place, away from the cold, and away from danger" The Glaceon responded.
"Away from danger, but not the cold" The dragonair added, "Actually, your not even away from the cold, its right beside you"
"Aren't you funny" The Glaceon snapped, a little annoyed at the "cold" joke.
As for the Leafeon, she couldn't stop giggling about it.
"Why were you named Summer when all you do is giggle? ... Should have called you Giggles..." The Glaceon said. Turning his attention to the Dragonair, he said "And the trainer should have called you sarcasm instead of Draco, you are far from a nobel dragon"
"And you are far from a Winter, you're more like a slushie." Draco replied.
1452222222222222222222222111.title: Dreaming

14522222222222222222222221112.content:
"Did you sleep well" Light asked Draco
"Sure, better than the past few days, didnt have to worry about Summer dying, just had to worry about what im going to do in the morning" Draco replied
"Ah" Light said as she sipped her coffee. Over the hill, Darkness was searching for berries, and a little further away, there was a hat resting on a rock. To the west, was Winter, admiring the glacier, and to the north, was the tent. "Well that was dissapointing, my coffee froze in the cup"
"thats unlucky" Draco said.
"That usually means a Frosslass is mourning, either way, we dont want to be caught in that storm." Darkness said, pointing to a large cloud to the east.
"Winter, you better get back inside, this storms going to be deadly" Light called
Winter didnt move.
"I'll get him, its not like he didnt hear you, he just wants to look at the glacier, he's mesmerised by it" Draco said, slithering down a hole punched in the snow's crust.
"ok then... i will wait inside"
This is going to be entertaining Darkness thought as he watched Winter start to look around. Winter started to walk back when the snow collapsed around him, and he fell through. Winter couldnt even cry for help before he was swallowed by the snow. Well, not as funny as i thought it would be, but still funny
Draco reappeared through the same hole in the snow, and coughed up Winter, who was obviosly angry about being eaten, and now he was covered in saliva.
"Why do you ALWAYS DO THAT!?!?" Winter shouted at Draco.
"Because its fun, and you're pretty darn tasty." Draco replied.
"could you please stop smiling like that?" Winter asked Darkness.
"Sure, but that doesent mean im not laughing on the inside"

14522222222222222222222222222222221211.content:
The forest was piercing white, the brown trunks and vague glimpses of green pine needles being your only dash or dose of color for what seemed like miles. Despite being new to this whole 'Yuki Pokemonna' thing, you felt as though you knew this place by frozen heart.

You were floating in place, body covered with the serenity you were feeling, no, your forest was feeling. This wasn't just a forest, it was your forest. Your home.

You felt as though you might be smirking with that thought as you glanced around once again, hands idly intertwining themselves together at your front. You seemed to have a decision.
14522222222222222222222222222222221211.title: Away From Home

145222222222222222222222222222222212111.content:
You found yourself wandering (floating?) on your way. You knew what path you were taking; it was the path home. You felt as if something was wrong as you found the entrance of your home, a den, a cave of ice.

Ah, who cares? You were home, that's all that mattered. you thought as you floated inside, looking up and around. Icicles were all over, right above the snow-covered floor, but you were focusing on your friends and decorations.

Hundreds of frozen bodies, Pokemon and Human alike, were connected to the ceiling or walls. Some were sad, others scared, and others looked to be asleep.

You would have smirked again if you could, running your small hands over the walls as you headed ever deeper into the cave.

What do you find?

15.content:
You just can't find ways to describe how you feel easilly. You don't feel bad, but you don't feel good. Not Sick, but not Healthy, not Hot, but not cold. Regular, but strange. All you can do is look in the water to see how you look. Too bad, you don't see your familiar human face looking back. You've been replaced with a pokemon.


::You Decide On Any Pokemon Here-Just Make Sure you keep it along the same lines as the rest of the story. Once all 5 slots are filled, you can add more via the "other" chapters.::

*This is the only Area that Legendary Pokemon are Allowed*
15.title: Strange, but Normal?

151.content: For some reason, you can't shake the feeling of instability, as if you didn't have you're own true body to stay as. You even struggle to stand up, but you slide around a lot. "Oh my god..." You think to yourself as you realize what you've become. A living, breathing, Ditto.
151.title: Ditto

1511.content:
You stare into the pond at the reflection that you are forced to admit is your's when you reach up and whack yourself in the face, falling over from the force of the blow before getting back up and rubbing your cheek. Or whatever it was this spot was on a Ditto.

Oddly you expected a body like this to feel slick and slimy, at least considering the way Ditto look, but instead it felt airy, like you were a mist of sorts, and that the softest breeze could blow you away, yet it didn't.

Looking around you can feel the other pokemon in the forest rather than see them. You can tell what they are too, and you know instinctively that with just a little focus you could become any one of them that you choose to be.

Heck you even could become all of them at once if you wanted to, or so you thought, though you quickly push that particular image away from your mind, wanting to become human, not just another pokemon, or worse, some mutant combination of them.

Searching the immediate area you find nothing to indicate what changed you, though some of the voices from the forest you can hear are talking about a weird flash of light that you can only assume was your arrival. You aren't the least bit surprised to learn you can understand the oddly accented voices of the pokemon, considering you are one, and likely speak with the same accent.

Suddenly another voice spreads out over the forest, singing softly, and most of the other pokemon stop talking to listen. Interested you follow the sound of the music, the harmonious tone sounding to you like your mother singing a lullaby. Breaking through a bush you tumble into the clearing from which the song is coming and are face to face with....
1511.title: Facing the Face in the Mirror

choices: "Do some training against other pokemon in battle, & try to get some new forms."
"Try to make some new friends to aid you in the journey you shall soon take."
15111.content:
As you emerge from behind the bush, you find yourself face to face with a shiny golden-furred vulpix! She was sitting on a tree stump and singing with a beautiful voice, which you probably wouldn't have known to be so beautiful if you weren't a pokemon yourself. Suddenly, the vulpix stops her singing and looks toward you with a smile. She jumps down from the tree stump and approaches you.

"Greetings human... Er, well... I guess that you aren't exactly human anymore, now are you..."

"How did you know that-"

"Because my mother is the one who brought you here! There were some... Unfortunate complications along the way, however..."

"So that's why I'm a ditto now?"

"Yes..."

"Well, why did your mother bring me here in the first place?"

"I don't know the full reason myself, but I'll take you to her so that you can ask her yourself..."

"Alright, lead the way Miss Vulpix..."

"Oh please, call me Kitsune!"

"Ah, okay. Then lead the way Kitsune!"

Kitsune then nodded and began leading you into a forest. It took a while, but eventually you arrived at your destination: Kitsune's home. It was apparently nothing more than an enormous tree!

"Um... Kitsune? Am I missing something here? Isn't this just a tree?"

"To the untrained eye, it would appear so... Follow me..."

Kitsune then proceeded to walk toward the tree trunk. You thought she was going to bonk her head on the wood, but she simply passed through it and went inside the trunk! You decided to follow her lead and walk into the tree as well. As you had hoped, you simply passed through it and appeared inside what appeared to be a massive living room. The first thing that you saw was Kitsune, who was standing next to a shiny silver-furred ninetales. You assumed that said ninetales was her mother. You were about to say hello to her, but she beat you to the punch.

"Greetings former human, My name is Kyubi. I believe that you have already met my daughter Kitsune."

"Yes Miss Kyubi. My name is [your name], Nice to meet you. If you don't mind me asking, why did you bring me here?"

"Ah, yes... The reason I've brought you here... You see [name], while most humans are kind to pokemon, not all are. There are those who care only for capturing rare pokemon and selling them for profit. I brought you here so that you could be the bridge between pokemon and humanity."

"I see... Umm, Kitsune said something about 'complications' in bringing me here being the reason why I'm a ditto now. What exactly went wrong?"

"Well [name], when I brought you here, I attempted to give you the ability to speak our language. I failed, however, and this is the result. As long as you remain in this world, you shall be bound to that form forever."

"Okay, so when I finish my mission and you send me back home, I'll go back to normal?"

"Precisely. However, being a ditto could work out for the better. You will be able to transform into any person or pokemon that you've seen before."

"So does that mean that I can also turn back to normal?"

"You've looked in a mirror during your lifetime, correct?"

"Yes..."

"Then yes, you can. Keep in mind though that a ditto cannot remain permanently transformed. Eventually you will tire from prolonged transformation and return to the form of a ditto."

"Ugh... I figured that it wouldn't be that easy..."

"Things never are..."

"You got that right! Okay Kyubi, I guess that I'll do this for you. It's not like I have much choice in the matter..."

"Thank you,[name]. Your support is greatly appreciated. I suggest that you do some preparations for your mission first, however."

"Alright, what do you think that I should do?"

"I think that you should..."
15111.title: A bewitching vixen and the source of your turmoil!

15112.content:
You stand up as you look about the clearing in which you find yourself, wondering for the first time which route you're on, and more importantly where to go to get home, as you can tell by the girl's clothes that you aren't anywhere near there, the style of her garments just so odd.

"Um, hi there," you say cautiously, hoping that she'll react as if you were some kind of monster, as that would tell you she understood you. Her expression though, was nothing like that, and she leaped up from her seat, her song stopping in midnote as she stared at you an expression in her eyes that you couldn't really seem to make out, as it seemed to be a mix of emotions.

"Oh my, I didn't think any of the pokemon would come up to me like this. It's so nice to see such bravery considering what those awful Teams have been doing to you of late," she says, almost sweetly, and you smile at her, edging closer, hoping she's nice. At that moment she reaches down into a pouch you hadn't noticed she was wearing and pulls out a.....
15112.title: Songstress of the Woods

151121.content: She feeds you and asks, if you want to stay with her. She seems to be nice. But you don't know, if you can trust her.
151121.title: Pokemon treat

1511212.content: You don't want to become a pet. You want to change back into a human. You jump out of her hands and jump through the open window. Suddenly you see Team Rocket. They notice you and want to fight you.
1511212.title: Try to escape.

choices: Discretion is the better part of valor, RUN!!!
Teach this punk turtle a lesson
151122.content:
"I guess this'll make it easier to get you away from here," she said as she suddenly tossed the ball onto the ground it emits that usual whoosh noise as a bright light flashes and assumes the shape of a pokemon, this one specifically a Wartortle.

"Oh man, you've got to let me out of there more often girl, I feel like I've got a cramp in all my joints," says the pokemon as it starts to stretch a bit, and you just stare for a moment before pointing at it accusingly.

"Can she understand what you just said?" you demand from it, and the Wartortle eyes you oddly, obviously not having expected the question. It blinks for a few seconds and then scratches its chin before shaking its head no.

"Of course not. You know humans can't understand us. What are you, a newborn or something?" asked the Wartortle, and you get mad. The mocking tone of its words, for some reason sparking something inside you, and without really meaning to you suddenly find your body glowing with the power of transformation, the light body becoming hard as you assume the form of Wartortle.

"Alright Michelangelo, let's show this copy cat what you've got!" shouts the human girl, and her hand points at you.
151122.title: Wonder if Splinter Knows He's Moonlighting

1511222.content:
You take a stance, readying yourself for battle and glaring at the other Wartortle, hoping you at least look as tough as him, despite feeling ridiculous standing here like this, preparing to face down your mirror image.

"Okay, water gun!" she yells, and your opponent opens his mouth wide and then starts squirting at you. The jet probably would have worked too, had you been just about any other type of pokemon, but since you're a water type too it barely registers, and thinking quickly you find that this particular Wartortle knows the move, Headbutt.

Smiling you realize this girl is either a new trainer, or just one that's forgotten the basics, and intending on showing her you lean your head back, her shout telling you she thought the attack of her pokemon was working, at least up until the point where you vaulted forward, your skill glowing as you rushed through the air.

Your momentum is such that you slam into the Wartortle, sending it flying through the air, back towards the girl, who smartly leaps out of the way before a loud crash echos through the woods, scattering the nearby pokemon.

"Mikey!" she shouts as she rushes into the dust cloud you'd kicked up with your attack, and soon you can see her knelling beside the Wartortle, who looked too beaten to move, his eyes unfocused as he lay there groaning.

"Grrr, that jerk. Don't worry Mikey, we'll get him," she says as she holds out his ball again, and the pokemon is suffused with light, before seeming to disintegrate, vanishing inside. Turning to face you again she already has another pokeball at the ready and tosses it at you, releasing your next opponent.
1511222.title: Wartortle Soup Anyone?

15112221.content:
"Alright Bombshell, take this Ditto to the cleaners, for Mikey," she shouted as the shape in the light resolves into the form of a ten foot from tail to snout, Charizard, that roars in anger, causing you to wish you'd run away a moment ago.

"So, you beat up that disreputable Wartortle. I'd thank you if I didn't have to hurt you," came the feminine voice from that lumbering bulk, and your jaw just drops. The tone and inflection of the words belonged in the mouth of some beautiful woman, not to a monstrous dragon thing.

Still you don't have time to play it safe, and not wanting to lose the momentum of your last attack you decide to show the initiative this time, and pulling back your head as if you're going to unleash another headbutt you move forward and a stream of endless water shoots from your mouth.

The trainer and pokemon, likely used to battles that waited for them to move first, were taken aback when this one didn't, and the watergun hit the Charizard square in her chest, causing her to stagger backwards, her power draining as you hit her.

Her trainer was in fact forced to scramble out of the way as her pokemon lumbered backwards, its steps pounding into the earth as it flaps its wings and arms, trying to beat back the stream, and losing quickly, finally falling over backwards with the same expression as the Wartortle, with her eyes rolling around her head in uneven circles.

"Bombshell too? What kind of Ditto can take out two pokemon in one hit each?" asks the trainer as she looks at you, and you realize she's right. In order to do what you just did your stats must be ridiculously high, but that suited you fine, and you wondered what she'd pull out next as she put the Charizard back into its ball and reached into her pouch.
15112221.title: Flawless Victory

151122212.content:
"Pokemon Type, Ditto, stats *&$#@!" the electronic voice of the pokedex rings out over the clearing as the trainer tries to scan you with it, but then it beeps and whistles, smoke coming out from under its video panel as it tries to get a scan of your stats, and obviously fails.

"So, I'm hot stuff?" you ask yourself, you form suddenly changing back to that of a Ditto as you calm down. Looking at your hands, or rather, the nubs that pass for hands on a Ditto body you shake them, and then curl them up, before holding one high and one low, moving them out in a rhythm as you walk in a straight line in front of the trainer, doing a victory dance.

"Oh yeah, I'm the best!" you say as you do the old dance, thinking yourself to be really cool, though the girl just looks at you, the expression on her face one that said many words, and few of them good ones.

"I got beat by a freaky Ditto in the woods outside my first town. Great-Grampa Oak's gonna want to know all the details, and when daddy hear's about this he'll have my hide for stealing his pokemon, and then losing with them!" she cries out, and then holds her hands to her knees and starts really crying, tears streaming down her legs.

Stopping your victory dance, which was just a lame rip off of Walk like an Egyptian anyway, you go over to the girl to try and reassure her, when you realize that you are not only the cause of her troubles, but can't even speak to her directly.

Still you wanted to do something, and you reached out to touch her leg, a single tear falling onto you arm. Suddenly that point on your body glowed and you jumped back from the girl, wondering what in the world was going on as you felt yourself change forms again, and suddenly you were in the body of.....
151122212.title: More Transformations

choices: She asks what your name is
1511222121.content:
You could immediately tell that things felt a little bit more normal now. You could recognize the feeling of this body, from the top of your head to the tip of your toes, and could only conclude that it was the shape of a human. But it surprised you even more when you recognized your voice. It was yours!
 
You tried to pay attention to the situation, though, and looked back at the girl, now more your size. Your put your hand on her shoulder, and she removes her face from her hands to look at you. She is taken aback when she sees a human boy looking at her. "Where did you come from??" she says.
 
"I was that ditto you saw but I'm not really a pokemon! This is my true form, I'm a human. But I can't stay this way for long. Please, you have to help me" you say.
 
The girls tears have long gone. She stares at you in awe. "Are you really? That's kind of confusing".
 
"I don't understand it either" you say. Before you could say anything else, you can't feel your limbs anymore, and know you changed back into a Ditto. Sighing, you look up at the girl who is towering over you once again. Suddenly, she bends down onto her knees and...
1511222121.title: Convincing

1511222122.content:
"What the heck!" the two of you shout in unison, the voices coming out of your mouths sounding exactly alike, and causing you both to slap your hands over your mouth, you with your left and her with her right, creating an odd mirror image effect as the two of you stared at each other in abject horror at this turn of events.

"But...but?" she starts to stammer as you look yourself up and down, even poking yourself in your current chest, feeling bouncy and unbalanced because of the new decorations to your body which weren't there before.

"I'm a girl!" you shout at last, in defiance of what had just occurred, though you compose yourself quickly, running your fingers through your hair and then grabbing your twin's shoulders a bit roughly, though her shocked state makes it so she barely registers this.

"Listen to me I'm not a pokemon. I'm a human. I don't know what happened, but I woke up like this. You have to help me. Take me to a doctor somewhere that might know how to fix this!" you tell her, already feeling this form slip away, though for some reason you feel like you could assume it, or the Wartortle again anytime you wanted to.

A flash of light later and the scene in the clearing was back to as it had been, the girl staring at a Ditto that had just dished out a large can of butt kicking to her two best pokemon, and she seemed to be caught in a moment of indecision, that ended as she.....
1511222122.title: Reaching Out and Touching Someone

choices: Go ahead and press the button
Push the pokeball aside, telling her you'll walk
15112221221.content:
"Wow, this, this isn't a dream, you really looked like me for a moment or two there, didn't you?" she asked as her finger pressed into your stomach. Or were a stomach should be on a Ditto. Smiling at her you shook your head up and down emphatically.

"Okay then. Great Grampa Oak is definitely gonna wanna hear about this," she commented, more to herself than to you. Getting up,she started composing herself as she ran her fingers through her shoulder length red hair, taking several deep breaths before opening her eyes and facing you again.

"Alright, I'll take you back to him. Hopefully when he hears about this he'll forget all about Daddy's pokeballs being missing," she said, and then looked down at you, obviously wanting to ask you a question but not sure how to do it, and then shaking her head, choosing the direct approach.

"Since you're coming into town with me, I think it would be less conspicuous if you rode in a pokeball, though I'd understand if you don't want to," she told you, and then pulls out a pokeball that you somehow know is empty, and holding it out to you, obviously wanting you to press the button and activate it.

Looking at the tiny red and white ball you consider your options for a moment. She'd commented on the Teams being active in this area, and all of them were bad news true, but did you really want to ride around inside one of those little balls just to fit in a bit more?
15112221221.title: She Believes You!

choices: were accidentally released when the girl sat down to go to the restroom
151122212211.content:
You reach up and press the button. A bright red glow envelopes you as your surroundings seem to grow larger, and you are sucked into the ball. It actually seems rather roomy, and the material is soft enough to lie down and take a nap in- not a bad idea for the moment, you think, as you shut your eyes and curl up.
Suddenly, you awake to find yourself released from the pokeball. You look around to see that you...
151122212211.title: Go ahead and press the button

1511222122112.content: You wake up to find yourself in
1511222122112.title: something else

15112221221121.content:
Slowly you wake up to the sound of a rusty gate opening and then closing. Then you can feel your ball gently bouncing up and down as she goes up some stairs, and enters a building. You don’t feel or hear anything which is making you wonder where you are now. With no windows in your ball you can’t see out this just makes you feel more anxious about what is going on outside your ball.

Suddenly you hear a voice you recognized. It was professor Oak. He sounded angry as he said “Suzie, what were you thinking. You know your dad does not like when you take his Pokémon without his permission. I think I am going to have to call him up and tell him what you did this time.” Suzie retorted with “No grandpa don’t do that please I don’t want to interfere with his expedition please don’t do it.” she looked at the professor with the best puppy dog face she could make but still being sincere about not getting her dad involved. Oak looked at her and said “ oh alright but just don’t take his Pokémon again or I really will call him. though he hasn’t used them for battling in years he still cares for the deeply.”

Suzie lit up and ran to hug him saying “thank you grandpa” over and over. Then she said “oh yeah grandpa I need your help with this I found this ditto that was a human and turned into a ditto. And needs to know how he can change back to human. Can you help him?”

“hmm, let me see him I will run some tests on him and see if there is nothing I can do for him ok?” oak said to her. she handed the ball over to him and he told her “this might take a while come back later and I will let you know if I have found anything I can do.”
15112221221121.title: at oaks laboratory

151122212211211.content: If professor oak finds a way, that's it. You aren't a pokémon anymore. The story is over.
151122212211211.title: Obvious result

choices: You get to the girl's home unmolested
151122212212.content:
Pressing your hands, or the ends of your arms anyway, against the sides of the pokeball you push it out of your way and shake the top half of your body from side to side, telling the girl without words that you would rather walk, or whatever it is Dittos do, into town than be carried in a pokeball. It wasn't that you didn't trust her not to let you out, you just didn't want her to lose the ball, as any of the Teams you'd heard about would have stolen it from her without a second thought.

"Okay then, guess you want to stay outside then. I understand," she said as she placed the red and white orb back into her pouch and then scratched you just behind your left ear for a moment, as if you were some kind of pet. If you had been human, you would have objected to the treatment, at least until you got to know her better, but as a pokemon you couldn't resist it, the feeling so good as her fingers pressed into your squishy skin.

Getting up and smiling down at you she started to walk off in the direction with the least pokemon, or at least you couldn't feel as many over that way. It was odd really. You'd been living in a world full of them all your life, but as a Ditto you could literally sense each and every one of the local pokemon, right down to the types and abilities they knew, and it took you aback as you tried to count them, just those around he clearing, and lost your place at nearly two-hundred.

If you had been paying closer attention to the surroundings than to your sense of the pokemon, it was possible you might have noticed a tiny ball floating in the air, soundlessly, though it wasn't likely. After all you hadn't noticed it when you'd woken up, and it had been there the whole time, following you as you moved. Right at this moment though it seemed to be caught in a moment of indecision, scooting after you and then pulling back, before finally shooting off into the sky, towards some unknown destination.
151122212212.title: Someone's Watching Over You

choices: a girl about her age, a rival.
1511222122122.content:
Walking along behind the girl you soon find yourself on the road that runs through this area, and after a second or two of testing it, you see if it hurts you with the way you move in this body, you shoot off after her, her strides carrying her much fast than your own method of locomotion could, being a sort of pumping, like you imagined a worm or snake moved, though without the slime.

Once on the road the two of you made good time through the woods, the bright day moving all around you, the forest humming with the sounds of the pokemon as they did their daily business. All in all you would have loved to have a picnic on a day like today. Sitting in the grass no a blanket, munching on sandwiches with a girl.

Looking over at the girl you were following you notice for the first time just how pretty she is, her golden red hair falling down over her shoulders like sunlight spun into threads. If you'd been human you probably would be asking her if she wanted to join you for a short walk or something, similar to what the two of you were doing now, though being a Ditto kind of took away from that feeling.

"Oh no," she said suddenly as she grabbed you and tugged you off the side of the road behind a bush. So lost were you in your thoughts that you had missed the fact that you were now literally almost to town, only a small bridge separating you from it, though on that bridge stood a figure who obviously was a point of concern for your companion. Peeking under the bush you start to make out features and realizes it's.....
1511222122122.title: The Way is Barred

choices: on the ground, releasing a Venusaur.
at you, capturing you so she can drag you away.
15112221221222.content:
"Heh, I see you there Anna, time to come out," says the girl on the bridge as she smiles at the girl you're with. You'd actually been wondering where her name was, so it was nice to finally know, but the tone of those words coming from that girl on the bridge was just so mean that you wanted to go over and hit her with something.

"Go away Clara, I don't have time to play. I have to go see Professor Oak," Anna told the girl barring her path, standing up to face her. Not wanting to let her stand alone, you slide up next to her, though you realize that at your height it probably looks ridiculous. You stand a little taller than her ankle is high, which is to say about a foot, maybe less, which is small from what you remember of Dittos, but then, you aren't really a Ditto anyway.

"Ha, what's that thing? Find a wad of gum and shape it into a pokemon?" asked the girl on the bridge, and now you know you're going to get her. Her laugh is just so annoying, and full of spite that you wish you still had hands so you could pick up a rock and throw it at her, but you are suddenly held back, the girl looking at you with concern.

"Come on, we'll go around," she says, but you shake her off, pointing at the girl and growling angrily at her, your meaning impossible to misinterpret. You want to get her for what she'd said about you, and you start to move forward. The girl, Anna, seems to be caught for a moment as she tries to decide something, and then standing up she pulls a pokeball out of her pouch and tosses it.....
15112221221222.title: A Rival's Taunt

choices: Attack now, before Anna tells you too
Wait for the order, as if you were a real pokemon
151122212212221.content:
"Okay Audry, give him a hand," she said as a Venusaur materialized next to you out of the flash of light. Up next to that thing you looked really weak, as it had toes bigger than you, but you didn't care. You weren't here to look tough, you were here to be tough, and with stats like your's you should be able to take on any opponent with little trouble, though you started to look around for other forms to become, wondering when the girl would release your foes.

"Okay then, well lets go Magnaton and Machamp!" she shouted a moment later, and the two pokemon, unnamed by Clara, were standing in front of you. They looked tough two, and for a second you thought you might have made a mistake wanting to fight them, but then that girl started laughing again. So full of herself, so sure of victory, that you just started burning with rage, your eyes closing tightly to hold back the flash flood of anger.

When you opened them again your body was shifting already, though you soon figured out that you weren't becoming either of her two pokemon, as you grew a tail, and you could literally feel your body growing hotter as it changed. Looking down your form you wagged the tail from side to side once, and then opening your mouth as a flame appeared upon the tip of it, though light covering your body fading as it burned.

"What the!? How'd that thing become a Charizard?" asked Clara, and you shared her expression as you looked over your new form, and then down at the Venusaur, who was still facing her pokemon, getting ready for the coming battle.

"Focus new guy. You don't want her to win do you?" it asked, or rather she asked, the voice from this one about the same as that of the Charizard, Bombshell, though a bit less deep. Again you are struck by disparity between the body and the voice, but drop down and roar at your opponents, eyeing them and then grinning.
151122212212221.title: Another Battle and a New Power

1511222122122211.content:
Pulling back your head, you face still cracked by your smile, you let loose a stream of fire straight at the Magnaton, hitting it almost dead center where the three Magnavolts that made it up were connected, causing it to fly backwards and land in the small creek over which the bridge Clara was standing on stood.

The girl, used to her opponent's pokemon waiting for their trainer to give an order was taken aback a second time, and seeing an opening Anna smiled herself, almost in the same mocking manner that Clara herself did, but her smile had a warmth to it that the other girl's lacked. Studying her face as you looked over your shoulder you decided it was her eyes, which were brighter, and had more warmth to them than Clara's.

"Okay Venusaur, use Solar Beam!" she shouted, and the pokemon beside you hunched down, the flower on its back vibrating a bit as it started to collect light inside it. Clara, still off balance from the twin shocks that you gave her, issued no orders to her Machamp, who literally stood there, flexing his muscles in an attempt to intimatdate you, before your partner kicked her legs up and a beam of concentrated light blasted the thing into the creek beside the Magnaton, giving it a bit of a shock itself.

"What? No!" Clara cried out as she noticed the battle was already over. Pointing her pokeballs at her pokemon she drew them back in, and then took off running into town, not saying another word to the victors, and you do another victory dance, this time choosing the Moonwalk, moving your clawed feet over the ground and bowing your head before turning towards Anna and winking.

"That was awesome. I don't think I've ever seen Clara with that expression on her face before," she said as she recalled the Venusaur, and then ran up to hug you, her arms wrapping around your neck for a moment, before you felt yourself shrinking, and she let go just before she would have lost her balance and fallen atop you.

"Come on, I've gotta tell Great Grandpa Oak about you, and we have to get these pokeballs back to the lab before Daddy finds out they're missing," she said as she returned the pokeball to her pouched and scooped you up in her arms, taking off at a speed that was like a rocket to you, though you knew it was only a run. Her path is unerring as it moves towards a building near the edge of the city marked Pokemon lab and she steps inside, coming face to face with her.....
1511222122122211.title: Preemptive Strike

choices: lays you on the counter with the pokeballs.
15112221221222111.content:
"Anna, where have you been?!" demands a voice as soon as you two enter the lab, and you curl up into her arms a bit deeper, staring out of them at the man who's yelling at her. The features of his face denote him as being her father, obviously, while his hair is a dark shade of brown, indicating that Anna must have gotten her hair from her mother.

"Daddy! What are you doing here?" she asked as she backed up, trying to hide you a bit from her father, though only succeeding in causing his eyes to fall directly upon you. He seems to grow even more furious at this point, if that's even possible, and then shakes his finger at her angrily, a gesture that you would have run away from if you could have.

"Now young lady, I'm asking the questions here. First we find you snuck out of your room again, then Grandpa tells me my pokeballs are missing, then to top it all off someone says they saw you walking out of town into the woods!" he shouts the last part, obviously the woods being a place that was off limits to Anna for some reason, yet you remember your famous trainers, and one of them was Prof. Oak's grandson, Gary, who, though he looks quite a bit older, in his mid to late thirties, this guy obviously is.

"And now you come back into the lab carrying a pokemon in your arms. Tell me, did you pick it up in the woods?" he demands, and makes a grab for you, but Anna turns, protecting you from his grasp, and he seems almost ready to hit her for a moment, though then he closes his eyes and curls his hand into a fist while taking a deep breath, calming himself down. You notice that he holds it in for a ten count, a common anger control technique, before letting it out with a sigh.

"Alright, I won't yell at you anymore Anna, but you're in big trouble. Now drop that Ditto off for your Grandfather and return the pokeballs you took. Then we're going home where you and I can have a nice long chat about this," he says, ordering her while pointing at the counter. Taking the pokeballs out of her pouch she sets those in a tray, and then pauses, unsure if she should set you down or not. Taking a single heartbeat to decide as her father turns around she.....
15112221221222111.title: Gary's Mad

151122212212221112.content:
"Okay, you just stay here for now. Great Grandpa Oak'll take care of you and then we can tell him all about this later," she whispers to you as she lays you down on the counter beside the tray and then rises back up. Looking up at her you peer around the lab several times, seeing it to be a place full of sharp angles and shiny surfaces, exactly like one would expect for one of the premier pokemon labs in the country, though it felt, cold to you, and you weren't sure you wanted to spend a night here.

She doesn't get a chance to say anything else to you though, as her father puts his arm around her, and then guides her out the door, as if he were afraid that she might try to run away again just on the walk back to her house. Following her with your eyes you can actually see her home out of one of the windows near the front of the lab, Gary obviously having chosen his house based off it's location being very close to his grandfather's lab.

Sighing to yourself you start to take a closer look at the pokeballs beside you, and realize that there's six of them in total, all of them having come from inside her pouch, meaning she had three others that you hadn't seen yet. Or rather, her father did. These were his pokemon, not her's, she'd taken them for whatever reason and then run away, likely trying to get as far away as possible from home, only to run into you, a pokemon with abilities far beyond the norm.

Laying down on the hard counter you start to curl up, making your already tiny form even smaller as you sort of fold your body into itself. All in all it had been a tiring day, and outside you can see the sun just setting over the horizon. That meant you had been pretty far from town when you'd met Anna, as it had been a little past noon as far as you could tell, both by the position of the sun, and by your own hunger, which was still there, though you heard no groan of your belly.

Wondering for a moment what Dittos had for stomachs you are startled by a thud from somewhere down a hall just off of the one with the counter upon which you sat. Interested you decide to investigate and lean off the edge of the counter, peeking just around the corner as another boom echos, now obviously the sound of a door. At the end of the hall there's one last door, and it opens wide, automatically rolling aside as a shape walks through it, soon resolving into the form of a.....
151122212212221112.title: Waiting in the Lab

choices: You stand firm and take the shot like a man
1511222122122211121.content:
The man is dressed in a white lab coat, similar to what you remember the Professor from your own home town wearing, though he's obviously some kind of assistant, looking around and ill at ease as he moves down the hall, his shoes clacking against the tile as he went. He seemed to be worried about something too, as he looked around with a gaze that was searching, and then, staring at his hand in his pocket, you realized there was a needle in it.

"Let's see, where's that new pokemon Anna brought in," said the assistant, and you wondered for a split second what he meant by that. Had someone seen her put you down on the counter beside the tray, or had Anna's little outing been sanctioned by her great grandfather, which would of course explain why her father was so infuriated, his whole family working against him to get Anna out into the world of pokemon.

It takes you another second or so after this to realize that the needle in his pocket is likely meant for you, a standard procedure at the Lab in your town being to get a blood sample from new pokemon when they first come in, though with some, like Muck or the metal and rock pokemon it was a chiseling rather than an actual blood sample.

Thinking on this you are torn between several emotions. You hate needles, never been able to stand them, and you certainly didn't want to get pricked as a Ditto, when it felt like a good breeze could tear your body apart. But Anna was expecting you to stay here, and if you left she was the only one you could go to for the night, which might get her in even more trouble with her father if he found out about it. You only had a heartbeat before the assistant got all the way down the hall.
1511222122122211121.title: Standard Proceedures

15112221221222111211.content:
‘So long pokey!' you think at the man as you leap from the counter, spreading yourself out like a sheet so that you catch the air and drift down. Falling to the floor you slip under the edge of the counter just as he gets up to it, his shoes right in front of you as he starts to tap them, recognizing the pokeballs as the ones that Anna took with her, but not seeing what he had expected obviously.

"Hmm, that's odd. Did Anna not catch anything today?" asks the lab assistant, scratching behind his head with the hand holding the needle and pricking himself, which caused him to squeak a little bit, and then laugh at what he'd just done. Sighing in defeat he grabbed the tray and took it away, walking back down the hall. Waiting until you heard three slams of the sliding doors you made a run for the front, which slid open for you, despite your stature, and allowed you to run outside into open air.

Taking several deep breaths, feeling like some sort of spy, you start to look around, interested to note that this town seemed quite dead at the moment. There were lights on in houses, and several of the lab windows glowed, though you couldn't see inside them. However, there was no foot traffic. No one making moving outside. Not seeing any reason to stay outside yourself you start to move over towards Anna's house, which you remembered seeing before.

Sliding up to the wall you closed your eyes, hoping that your sixth sense worked with humans too, and indeed it did. You can feel Anna moving towards the back of the house, to a room that had an open window. Of course, the front door is hanging open too, and it offers an easier entry, though more possibility of being seen by Gary. Considering things for a moment you look at both entry options, weighing the pros and cons.
15112221221222111211.title: Don't Like Shots, Do You?

151122212212221112111.content:
You might as well continue to the spy thing you had going on, or so you thought to yourself as you slithered towards the wall with the window, beyond which was the end or your quest. Of course, as soon as you were facing it, you found some very immediate difficulty considering the window itself was high off the ground.

Even had you been your normal height you wouldn't have been able to reach the window without assistance, as it had to be something near the ceiling inside the room itself. That meant that reaching it at your current height, which was just above Anna's ankle, was going to be a challenge, but, having bested three different pokemon today in direct battle, you were feeling up to almost anything, and so you moved over to the wall.

To your relief your body was sticky enough that it could cling to the brick house, though you did a quick test by pulling yourself up with one arm and then hanging there for a moment or two, making sure you wouldn't peel off half way up the wall, only to fall back down and break... well break whatever it was Dittos had for bones. Sure that you can make it you start going upward, swinging from side to side and slowly edging your way up the wall, until at last you come up over the edge to look into the room, which is the kitchen of the house.

Looking down you see Anna is making herself something to eat, two jars open on the counter, and a plate with to slices of bread in between them, one already brown with peanut butter. Looking at the drop, you find yourself forced to choose between trying to land on Anna, and trying to land in one of the jars, to ensure a soft landing. Taking a moment to decide you leap off the edge, your course taking you right.....
151122212212221112111.title: A Choice of Landings

choices: puts the peanut butter covered slice on top of you.
1511222122122211121111.content:
You fly down through the air, waving your arms to get Anna's attention as you fall, though her head is turned away from you. Not wanting to make any noise, and thus, be discovered by her father, you simply curl up and allow yourself to splat into the jar, the jelly soon pulling at you to try to draw you under like some kind of bog, though you grab at the side and pull yourself out, pounding on the jar as you move to get Anna's attention.

Unfortunately her attention at the moment belongs to a larger shape that walks into the kitchen behind her. Gary's voice, a bit muffled because your ears are full of jelly, echos over the room, and you sigh, waiting for him to leave as you don't want him to discover you're here. Trying to be inconspicious you start to let the jelly pull you under.

Before he gets a chance to leave though the knife plunges into the jar and you almost scream as it starts to rattle around inside, though you control yourself, not wanting Gary to see you and get Anna in trouble. Of course that doesn't stop Anna from getting you into trouble as you soon find yourself in open air again, and cling tightly to the knife to avoid slipping off, before you are spread on a slice of bread.

Sputtering and choking you continue to hide in the jelly, your skin tone almost the same as it, as Anna and her father talk for a little while, discussing among other things, her desire to start her pokemon journey, with you as her starter. Gary seems a bit taken aback by this little tidbit of information, and says nothing, before shaking his head and leaving. Knowing a good opportunity when you see one you stand up and wave you arms and Anna.....
1511222122122211121111.title: This May Have Been a Bad Idea

choices: on her tongue, inside her mouth.
15112221221222111211111.content:
You fight a little bit as the second slice is placed atop the first, but your strength, no matter what your stats say, is not even enough for one girl to notice, and you soon feel yourself getting smushed into the contents of her sandwich, which now includes you as one of the fillings, a fact that causes you to squirm and move, but to no avail.

"Heh, I wonder what that Ditto human eats?" you hear her question herself, and then suddenly you feel a quick movement that signals she's taking a bite. Somewhere nearby you hear a sound like a grinding millstone as her teeth work through the bread and tear off a hunk of it into her mouth as she walks into the living room, flipping through channels on her television, including some police reports on Teams Rocket, Gamma, Aqua, and Magma, all of which had been active recently.

"So much destruction, and for so little point," she says to herself, and then swallows what's in her mouth, from inside the sandwich all you can do is watch as her mouth grows to fill your entire field of vision, and then you are cast into the absolute darkness of her body, expecting to feel the pain of her masticating your form to goo. When you open them back up you're sitting.....
15112221221222111211111.title: You're in a Bit of a Jam

151122212212221112111111.content:
For a moment, there is no movement whatsoever inside her mouth, and everything seems calm, as if she were waiting for something. That is until you decide to try to get out, and part of your body slips into her throat, causing her to swallow. She chokes and sputters as you, the bread, and the goo that held the three together get caught in her throat for a moment, before a gulp of milk spills all three of you into her belly.

Her beating heart creates a rhythm as you splash onto the waves inside her stomach, and for a moment you panic as you slosh over to the wall, intent on pounding on it, but the motion of the liquid you're floating on forces you back, not allowing you to draw any closer to them, always pushing you out into the middle.

Oddly it doesn't burn or stink, or anything inside Anna's stomach, at least, not like you thought it would. Instead it's sort of nice, the air pleasantly wet against your skin, like that at the ocean, and the liquid around you is only mildly warm, like bath water that had been let cool for a little while. Yawning you start to feel yourself falling asleep, though you know you should fight it, you can't, and soon your eyes shut, never again to open, and the last sound you hear is the deep thudding of Anna's heart above you.
151122212212221112111111.title: Peanut Butter, Jelly, and Ditto Sandwich. Yum

151122212212221112111112.content:
The blaring alarmclock beside your bed shakes your eardrums as it's set so loud, but you barely notice it as you open your eyes, looking around at your familiar room, wondering what's going on, and how you got here. The last thing you remembered you were somewhere bad, about to have something worse happen to you.

Looking at your hands you find they're indeed your human hands again, and tossing off the covers you run into the bathroom. Staring into the mirror you look yourself over, giving a quick check on your looks and finding that you looked about the same as you did the other day. Running your fingers through your hair, you feel a squish, and drawing them back you find they're covered with some kind of goo that you lick to find out it's jelly.

"What did I do yesterday?" you ask yourself as you look into the mirror, the reflection looking just as perplexed as you yourself felt.
151122212212221112111112.title: The Morning After Syndrom

1511222122122211121112.content:
You land with a thunk sound as your body makes contact with Anna's skull, and for just a second you think she might scream out as you strike her, but shaking her head she knocks you off silently, grabbing you out of the air with reflexes that were better than you would have expected from the pampered daughter of a famous trainer and gym leader like Gary.

"What the? What are yo-" she starts to question you as foot steps echo from behind and not seeing anywhere else to hide you she shoves you into the jar of jelly, which was your second target, just as Gary walks into the kitchen.

"Anna, I just wanted to say, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have blown up like that, but I've told you before, I don't think you're ready to be a trainer. You're old enough, sure, but you need to learn responsibility, too. You have raise your own pokemon from scratch like I did," he starts telling her and you scrunch down into the jelly, seeing his shape through the clear, but jelly covered walls.

"I know Daddy, and I think I might have found my own starter pokemon today. I was collecting samples for Great Grandpa Oak again when I discovered a really powerful Ditto. I'm kind of hoping that Grandpa let's me keep him," she says, her shadow turning to face her father as she drove her knife into the jelly on the far end from where she'd placed you, and then it moved closer, scrapping along your side of the jar, telling you to get on.
1511222122122211121112.title: Hiding You From Daddy

15112221221222111211121.content:
Emerging into the light of the kitchen you can see Anna sharing a moment with her dad, though she turns one eye to her knife to make sure you're on it before spreading it on the bread and quickly flipping the other slice onto it, hiding you from Gary for the moment, though her expression as she did so told you she'd want an explanation later.

A few silent minutes later you feel motion as the late you are on is picked up and carried through the house. Soon you hear the sound of a door, slightly muffled through the sandwich, and then feel someone pull at you, tugging you out of the slimy, sticky mixture and into the air again, Anna smiling at you as she set you down on the plate again and then took a large bite of her snack.

"So, mind explaining what you're doing back here?" she asked as she chewed, and you got an embarrassed look on your face, before you tried to tell her, though she laughed, and so did you, when you realized she couldn't understand you.

"Alright, never mind. It's not that important anyway, since I was going to come get you tomorrow anyway. I'm sure you heard, but I want to start my pokemon journey tomorrow, and well, if you'd be willing, and if Great Grandpa says he can't figure out a way to get you back to normal, I'd like you to be my starter pokemon, how's that sound?" she asked, and you are startled silent for a moment, and then, looking at your jelly soaked form you right out your answer on the plate.
15112221221222111211121.title: Anna's Question

151122212212221112111211.content:
"You will?" she asks, as if confirming your answer, and when you shake your upper body up and down she almost squeals with delight, tossing the sandwich aside as she picks you up and twirls you about the room, obviously very excited about the prospect of going off. Giggling and laughing she sets you back down on the bed and rips the last of her snack in half, holding out one of the pieces to you, and finding yourself quite hungry you take it from her.

Oddly you don't have to think about what you do next as you open your mouth wide and push the sandwich into you, despite it's size, it slips right into you body, and you gurgle with pleasure at getting a square meal for the first time in about twenty four hours. Watching you eat Anna just stares, and then bursts out laughing as she pushes her own half into her mouth, and is forced to chew before she can swallow it.

"Wow, I guess you were hungry. After all, you fit in that sandwich well enough I bet I could have eaten you and never noticed, though you downed it in one gulp like that," she commented and then placed the plate on a nearby dresser, climbing into her bed beside you, patting her stomach and then placing you atop it.

"Okay, well, tomorrow I'll take you to Grandpa's lab, and then we can figure out if he knows how to get you back to normal or not. If he doesn't, then we can have some real fun together on our journey," she said, laughing at you and then slowly closing her eyes. Looking at her, you noticed she slept in her gear. Obviously a camper or outdoors type person, she would do well on the road, though you wondered if you would as you curled up on her belly and went to sleep.
151122212212221112111211.title: A Monstrous Appetite

1511222122122211121112111.content:
You feel a poke as you lay on a bed. Much softer than your's, and warm too, with a vibrator set on low as it seems to thud every once in a while. Curling up again you try to ignore the poking, but it becomes persistent, and then, without warning you tumble off as the bed under you moves, and you remember in one cold flash the events of yesterday.

"Morning sleepy head," comes Anna's voice as she laughs at you. Rubbing your eyes you try your best to smile at her as she leaps over you onto the floor and your eyes fall upon the window, which is just starting to get bright outside. You wish for a moment that you were human so you could make some crack about ‘five more minutes' but all that comes out of your mouth is the word Ditto. She seems to get the message though as she pokes you again, and then scoops you up in one hand.

"Nope, we have to get going before Daddy comes in to check on me. If we get there fast we can get to Great Grandpa Oak before anyone else comes to see him this morning. Once he hears about your case I'm sure he'll cancel all his other appointments today so he can focus on you," she says, though you know deep down she's still hoping he won't find anything.

She doesn't say this though, as she straps her pouch back on and slips you inside it, before zipping in closed and sealing you inside. Taking this moment to rest some more you lay against the side, interested to note that the pouch is empty for the moment, and that gives you a lot of room, though the walls, plastic coated and waterproof when the zipper is done all the way, muffle sound, Anna saying something to her father, and him responding before you two leave her home.

It takes less than a minute to walk over to the lab, and you can hear the whoosh as the door slides aside for you, and then you can hear Anna's voice, excited as she calls out someone's name, and then a familiar voice responds, though you can't place where you heard it before. A second later it matters little as you are freed, Anna reaching into her pouch and drawing you out to set down on the counter before her and......
1511222122122211121112111.title: Sneaking You Out

choices: away at a Pokemon Profs. Convention.
in the back lab, immersed in a project.
15112221221222111211121111.content:
"So this is the sample you got yesterday then? I knew it wasn't like you not to catch something, especially with your dad's pokemon, but was it really a good idea to take this one home with you?" he asked as he walked away, and then reached into a nearby cabinet to produce the needle from yesterday too, and you instantly curled up against Anna's hand on the counter next to you.

"Oh, don't want to get shot? Well don't worry, this won't hurt a bit," he told you, and came closer, but Anna scooped you up off the counter into her arms, and held them about you protectively while pressing you into her chest.

"Not this one Victor. Sorry, but he's a bit special compared to your run of the mill specimens. He's going to be my starter," she announced to him, and you would have felt a bit frustrated that she was so hyped up about that, as you were still kind of hoping that Oak would be able to cure you, though anything that made him put the needle down, which this did, was good in your opinion.

"Oh, so your dad finally let you start your own journey then?" he asked her, and Anna's smile beamed. You were aware that she hadn't actually talked to her father about going off right now, but then, this might have been a protracted discussion and you'd only caught the end of it. Besides your vantage point on that conversation hadn't been all that great, being inside a jar of jelly at the time.

"Well, he didn't say no, and you know that's what he really wanted me to do, to find my own starter pokemon, and here he is. Though before I start I have something to discuss with Great Grandpa Oak.
