If you could get him we'd be really grateful," she told him, and Victor's expression seemed to droop a bit, as if he'd been dreading this question, and when he opened his mouth to speak he told you that Oak was.....
15112221221222111211121111.title: Victor Was His Name

151122212212221112111211111.content:
"Wait, what?" asked Anna, her expression one of absolute surprise, and her grip around you suddenly got a lot tighter, though you kept from crying out. After all, it really didn't hurt you, it didn't even feel painful. It didn't feel all that good either, but then, you were being squished up against yourself as her hand folded around you.

"It was a sudden thing, and he only left yesterday. Apparently some head honcho at the PokeCorp that makes the poke balls decided to call it about something his Department of Research and Development had uncovered, he said it could transform the relationship between pokemon and humans forever, and he's getting all of them together. He also promised heightened security this time, after Team Rocket took them hostage during the last such gathering," he said quickly, and you both looked at each other.

It was likely it had nothing to do with your transformation, though in all truth what were the odds that this conference would be called on the exact same day as you wake up to find yourself in the body of a pokemon? Probably very good really, considering a head of a company could deem anything to be the sort of discovery that changed the world, though this was a chance you couldn't dare to pass up, and looking at Anna you saw the whole train of thought follow it through to the end in her mind as well.

"Okay then, I guess this guy and I are going after Oak, Victor. If you could give me a new pokedex then we'll set off today. We should be in the city by the middle of next week," she told him, and he looked at her for a moment, then at you, probably trying to guess just how long it would take her to get there from here.

"What happened to the pokedex you got for specimen gathering? Why won't it work for you now?" asked the assistant after a moment or two, nodding his head as he spoke, agreeing with her travel time assessment, though it also put Anna in a position to lie and make something up, or tell him the truth of the other day, and looking at you she seemed to ask you if she could, after all, it was your secret.
151122212212221112111211111.title: Prof. Not in the Lab Right Now, can I take a Messa

1511222122122211121112111111.content:
Anna sighs in relief as you nod at her, and Victor, watching, is obviously a bit perplexed by the action of a trainer looking to their pokemon for an answer, though he waited for an explanation silently, as did you yourself, wondering just what Anna would say about yesterday, as she knew only a bit, what you'd been able to tell her before changing back into this form.

"Well, Victor, the pokedex I was using kind of blew a fuse yesterday when I tried to scan this little guy to get his stats," she started, and set you down on the counter again. By this point Victor had set the needle aside, and while you were bit nervous with how close he was getting, and even growled at him a bit when he poked you, you allowed him to study you.

"Hmm, this is a bit small for a Ditto. If I remember correctly the average height for one of them is in the area of a foot or so tall. This one is barely three inches," he said as he stood up again, and you almost wanted to attack him. So what if you were short, you'd kicked the butt of two fully evolved pokemon, and one that was at a second of three stage evolution, all with relative ease.

"He is, but that's probably because he's not a normal Ditto. Victor, yesterday, this little guy not only beat Michelangelo and Bombshell, which in and of itself is quite a feat, but then he transformed into me," she told him, and he nodded a few times at this information, as if it held no meaning, before his eyes sort of got wide and he stared at her, then shifted his gaze back to you.
1511222122122211121112111111.title: Telling the Truth

choices: Anna decides to head out for the convention
Anna wants to try to get into the lab anyway
15112221221222111211121111111.content:
"So, that means you're human, right?" he asked you directly, and it was your turn to stare at him, though while staring you shook your head up and down emphatically to tell him that it was so as to tell him that he's right, while Anna stands with her mouth slightly open at him before shaking her head to clear it.

"Well, that's what he said while he was me. How'd you know?" she asked him, and Victor scratched his chin, obviously considering his answer for a moment before sighing and taking off the glasses he'd been wearing, rubbing the bridge of his nose by pinching it between his thumb and finger, before turning to Anna with a smile.

"That's a long story, and it mostly involves one of the projects here at the lab that I've been doing with your Great Grandfather involving some of the new mineral deposits that were discovered on Cinnabar Island after the volcano exploded. Some of them have very unusual properties, and well, one of them is merging pokemon together," he told the two of you, and you started shouting, though they couldn't understand a word of it.

"If I had to guess, I'd say your friend there is asking if, since we know what caused it, can we reverse the process. Well, the answer is, sadly, I don't know. Prof. Oak and some of the other assistants were working on a way I believe, however most of them have already gone back to their home towns during the conference, and I can't get into that section of the lab without the Prof.," he told you both in an apologetic tone, though Anna didn't look discouraged.
15112221221222111211121111111.title: A Possible Explanation for Your Condition

151122212212221112111211111111.content:
"Don't worry about it Victor. We'll go find Great Grandpa and see what he has to say about this. Along the way we can take some gym leaders down a peg or two since this guy registers as a Ditto. After all, the pokedexs here are supposed to detect things like genetic tampering and stuff, meaning he's legal to use in battles," she said, a statement of fact, rather than a question.

Without another word Anna grabbed some pokeballs from the counter, empty ones, or so you assumed, and then, from a small computer station she took one of the pokedexes plugged into the terminal before placing both inside her pouch and walking back over. Smiling she scooped you up in her hand again she and placed you gently beside the other items before waving back at Victor as she left the lab, her stride confident and sure.

Victor, looking after her, seemed a bit exasperated, but didn't even try to stop her. Instead he pressed a button on the same console, and a screen came to life, on it, a picture of your current self, and out beside that a few stats, from height, to guessed weight, and then farther down some were listed as normal pokemon stats of Attack, Defense, and such. The message under them, rather than numbers, was the word ERROR, blinking bold and red.

"Interesting," he said as he typed another key and the message saving appeared on the screen in front of your entry. Slowly the bar under it filled, and then a ping echoed through the lab as it said it was finished. Smiling Victor reached over and tapped a button on the side of the terminal, causing the machine to whine a bit before the screen.....
151122212212221112111211111111.title: Victor Takes Your Measure

choices: Clara, the trainer from yesterday, Anna's rival.
Gary, Anna's father, coming to drag her home again.
1511222122122211121112111111111.content:
"Hmm, it has been quite a while since you decided to make contact with us Victor," said the figure as it slid across the screen, to be replaced by a more feminine looking one, and looking close anyone watching could see that there was still a third figure in the background that had not come forward, the three of them sitting on some kind of special hanging chair formation that rotated.

"I haven't had any information worth communicating of late. Oak's latest projects, while good for us, have been of public knowledge, and thus, with little need for me to do anything other than file reports and send them in after the fact. However, a little tidbit of information just came into the lab, and I think you might want to have a look," he said, and a key stroke later he sat back in his chair as a transmission went out to the trio's hidden location, flashing on their own screens for a moment.

"Indeed, this does look promising. Tell me, what is the processing limit of Oak's scanners?" asked the third figure as it slid into the foreground.

"Ten times ten to the ninety seventh power. I know this for a fact because I designed them," he proclaimed proudly, and the three figures on his screen seemed to look at each other for a moment, before the first one slid into view again.

"This specimen deserves farther scrutiny. Were you able to detain it?" he queried, and Victor shook his head no.

"Still, I know where it's going. I'll transmit that when I get a chance. Perhaps you can claim it from the one who possess it. If not, it will still provide good data," he told them, and all three nodded, before the screen went blank as one of the back lab doors opened up, and Prof. Oak stepped into the terminal room.

"Excuse me, Victor. Did Anna come by today?" he asked, and Victor sighed as he shook his head in answer.

"Not today Prof. Though I saw her walk by towards the road. Perhaps you'll spot her from the air on the way to the conference," said Victor, waiting for him to leave before leaning over his console again, bringing up a small video box in one corner of you and Anna leaving town, and then a figure moved out after you, looking closer he saw that it was.....
1511222122122211121112111111111.title: Foreshadowy Goodness

choices: Teach Clara another lesson in humility
15112221221222111211121111111111.content:
The two of you were actually really starting to enjoy the day as you walked. Or rather, as Anna walked. You were riding, comfortably in her pouch towards the edge of town, the top of it open so that you could look out on the beautiful day outside, with the sky blue as could be, with only a stray fluffy white cloud here and there in it, as the pidgey chirped somewhere in the distance.

"Oh man, it just feels so liberating to be going off like this," she said as she made her way across the bridge, her foot steps clanking on the wood. You had to agree with her. You had never felt like this before, never having taken a pokemon journey yourself. It was quite a rush, though you wondered if she had any money on her, as food would be a problem if she didn't.

"Still the child, huh Anna?" came a familiar voice, and your view whipped around back towards the way you had come, tossing the contents of the pouch about, before you looked out on a scene that caused you some serious deja vu. Standing on the bridge was Clara, that smug grin on her face, and you remembered how much you wanted to hit her.

"Word is you're going off today on your pokemon journey. At least, that's what your dad told mine, and guess what, my daddy's said I can go too. He even gave me one of his old pokemon as my starter, as a going away present, and of course, some money to start me off too. Since I know your dad didn't give you any, I thought I might offer to battle," she said, though you and Anna both looked at her in a distrustful manner, knowing she was getting at something.

"If you win, I'll give you half of my money, but since you don't have any, if I win, I get that little pokemon you used on me yesterday," she declared, and then flashed a few coins in the air. Anna, caught between her need for funds at the moment, and her fear of losing you this quickly, opened the flap of her pouch, and voicelessly asked if you wanted to.
15112221221222111211121111111111.title: Clara, Round II

151122212212221112111211111111111.content:
Leaping out of the pouch you land on the ground, your arms moving in a circle in front of you and punching forward, as if you were warming up for a boxing match. Nodding at your decision, Anna stamped her foot down on the ground beside you and pointed at Clara, a non-vocal accept to her challenge, though when she looked down again she seemed a little worried, her stamp having knocked you over, her foot literally right next to you, nearly squishing you.

"Alright, I guess that means I get to show that little jelly stain whose boss around this place," said Clara as she looked at you, her grin showing many different emotions, and none of them nice or kind in any way, causing you already liquidlike skin to crawl a bit as she reached over and took a pokeball off her belt.

"Okay, I choose you, Typhlosion!" cried the rival trainer as she tossed her pokeball to the ground, the button pressing down as it hit. The pokeball leapt into the air, and a bright light shot out from inside it as it cracked open, soon resolving itself into a nearly seven foot tall weasel like creature with a mane of flame around its neck, roaring as it looked down at you, knowing somehow that you were its opponent.

"Nervous yet?" taunted Clara as Typhlosion stepped off the bridge towards the two of you, and in response you leaped forward yourself, sailing three feet forward and holding yourself in front of Anna protectively.

"You won't get past me," you tell the opponent, as you focus yourself inward again, and soon your body glows with power, shifting and rearranging itself as it assumes a new form, a more powerful looking one than your normal tiny body, as you focus your mind on the pokemon form you think will be able to fight this creature best.
151122212212221112111211111111111.title: Choose Your Weapon

choices: You hit Typhlosion with Hydro Pump
You use Skull Bash to strike it hard
1511222122122211121112111111111111.content:
"Heh, I was expecting him to do that again. I can't wait until you're mine, little one, then I can sell you to one of the labs so they can figure out how you can transform into pokemon that aren't even around when you're in battle," she says as she points her finger at your current shelled form, smiling again at you, and making you wish you could curl up inside your shell.

"Okay, well, first I have to win him. Use Quick Attack Typhlosion, and end this in one shot!" she shouted, and you had to commend her on strategy. Another trainer might have tried to still use one of their pokemon's more powerful, but less effective attacks, considering your types. This was the sign of a good trainer, though you kind of wished she weren't so good as you suddenly felt a hard blow to your chest, falling backwards and off balance.

"Ha! Down in one strike, good work Typhlosion," Clara told her pokemon, who had never appeared to move, his speed during the attack faster than the blink of an eye. Still she was highly overconfident. The attack, thanks to your defense had done very little damage to you, though she assumed that you being on your back meant you were down for the count, which certainly the case here, though you felt strangely winded, which you hadn't expected.

Back in his lab, Victor was again staring at your screen, obviously trying to enhance it a bit farther to get an exact reading on your stats when he scrolled over the rest of your data, suddenly looking at the top statistic, and then scratching his chin, obviously having trouble accepting what he was seeing on his monitor.

"Stats that high, and an HP score of only four? Now that's rather odd. Still, with those stats no matter what he's hit with, even moves like Dragon Rage that are supposed to take off a set amount of HP will only do one point of damage. I just hope Anna remembers to give him a potion every once in a while," he comments to himself, while elsewhere you rock back onto your feet, and prepare to launch your counter attack falling onto all fours to prepare for it.
1511222122122211121112111111111111.title: You're a Four Hit Wonder

15112221221222111211121111111111111.content:
Pulling your head back into you shell you grin at the Typhlosion, who seems a bit taken aback that you were able to get back on your feet, as does Clara, who, despite what she saw yesterday, obviously though her dad's pokemon would be able to beat you. You were more than happy to disappoint her on this point.

Leaping into the air you quickly pull your arms and legs into your shell with you, and then suddenly jets of water stream out from inside you, most of their force being directed right at the Typhlosion, which is struck mid chest with it, sending it flying through the air in almost the same way as the Magnaton from yesterday.

Unlike the Magnaton though, this pokemon is a serious contender, having done battle with the Elite among all the trainers. He shifts his weight as he flies, and suddenly breaks out of the stream, rolling to the ground, and then landing on his feet, grinning at you in an almost mirror of Clara's own evil looking smirk, his mane flaring even more brightly.

"Heh, not so easy this time, is it? Okay, since he took that attack so well, how about you hit it with a Flame Wheel this time?" asked Clara, and Typhlosion looked over his shoulder at her for a moment, before nodding. Turning back to face you, he watched as the streams you were firing off slacked down to nothing, and you fell back to the ground, your head and limbs emerging from your shell as you landed. With you in front of him, Typhlosion started to glow for a moment with power and then......
15112221221222111211121111111111111.title: Counter Attack Time

151122212212221112111211111111111111.content:
"Hey what the?" asked Clara as her pokemon seemed to waver for a bit, his body still alight with the energy he'd been gathering to use against you, before it all faded away, and he turned back into light, returning to his pokeball without another word, your attack having depleted his HP, but his constitution allowing him to remain on his feet until he'd tried to power up a move.

"Alright. That's a victory Clara. Your pokemon's unable to battle," declared Anna as she wrapped her arms around you neck, and kissed you on your cheek, causing you to blush for a second as you put one clawed head behind your head, scratching your hard skull, just before your own body became suffused with light, and you changed back to your tiny, handheld form, sitting on her palm.

"Humph," responded Anna's beaten rival as she walked over. Her face was easy to read, as she wasn't trying to even cover her distaste with her defeat. Still she didn't object as she stood right in front of Anna, and then held out one fist in front of her. Reaching her own hand out and putting her palm below Clara's fist, she caught some shiny coins. Then, defeated, but not beaten, Clara stalked off.

"Our first of hopefully many victories. Want to go by the Pokemart before we leave town, and maybe grab some supplies?" she asks you, differing once again to your judgement. Looking back towards Clara, who was walking towards the town's Pokecenter, you considered for a moment before pointing your hands towards your next destination.
151122212212221112111211111111111111.title: Anna & You 1 : Clara 0

choices: She's stopped by Gray before getting out of town
She makes it to the forest this time
1511222122122211121112111111111111111.content:
You remember your old proverbs about battles won and lost, and of course, overconfidence. It was the highest form of hubris to believe that you could slug your way through every battle, even with the ability to take down opponents with one hit like you were. After all, you still hurt from that Quick Attack Typhlosion had hit you with, which told you that you weren't invincible.

"Okay. I'll pick up some food there too, since in a small town like this they carry both pokemon and human supplies," she told you, and then placed you back inside her pouch. You didn't doubt her word either, even though the sign reading Pokemart was the only one visible on the building. Several smaller towns along certain Routes combined a pokemon store with a general store, just to save space.

Walking inside Anna started to grab what she needed from the shelves of the store, including a small backpack to carry her supplies in, taking her pokeballs and pokedex out of her pouch and placing them in press designed pokes while smiling down at you, leaving you with a now open carrying case. She even grabbed three small pads, designed for clothes, and slipped them in there around you, for your comfort.

"Ditto," you say, both to yourself and her, knowing she can't understand you anyway. Of course, inside you're thinking the word thanks as you snuggle into one of the pads, yawning. Having gotten up a bit early this morning, you were still tired, and the battle hadn't helped, but you force yourself to stay awake as you watch her move through the store.

Grabbing food next, including several fruits and vegetables, as well as snacks, and some wrapped sandwiches, stuffing them into her bag alongside the pokemon supplies. She seemed to stop and consider before picking up a box of Brock's Famous Pokemon Treats, one of the biggest brand names in that particular business, and then walking up to counter and ordering as many potion and curative items as she could afford before she walked out of the store, really ready for her pokemon journey now as she walked towards the bridge.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111.title: Stocking Up On Supplies

15112221221222111211121111111111111111.content:
"Anna, wait!" comes a familiar voice, and you feel the girl tense a little bit as the pouch curls in on itself. For a moment, just a second, you are afraid she might try to run for it, across the bridge and to the freedom she craved. She didn't though, and with a sigh she turned, your view suddenly dominated by the view of her father, running up and then stopping a little in front of her as he caught his breath.

"I was hoping I'd catch you hear," he told the two of you as he got his wind back, his words punctuated at times by a bit of wheezing. He was obviously a bit out of shape, which wasn't uncommon for gym leaders, especially ones in out of the way places like this, where they got little to no foot traffic, only the occasional trainer stopping by to get their badge for the league.

"Dad," she starts, about to say something, but Gary holds up his hand to stop her.

"Listen Anna, I know what you're going to say, because I remember what Ash told me when we started out journey. You've always been just as bullheaded as him, and you even both kept your starters out of pokeballs," he said, grinning at you in the pouch, and you sort of wave at him, a motion you are surprised he returns.

"I know you expect me to try and block you know, but I'm not going to. Instead, I'm going to wish you luck. I'm sure that's what your mother would have wanted me to do. Still, if you ever want to come home, if the trials of the road are too much, remember that I'm hear for you," he said, and then he hugged her once, crushing you a bit, but you said nothing as you watched this father/daughter moment.

"Dad, I...I...I love you Daddy, and I promise to make you proud!" she declared then and there, kissing him once on the cheek before running across the bridge and heading off into the woods. Smiling at her back, he waves goodbye just as a helicopter passes overhead, going in the same direction you two are as you start your pokemon journey.
15112221221222111211121111111111111111.title: A Father/Daughter Moment

151122212212221112111211111111111111111.content:
Laying down into one of the pads you gaze out of the pouch as Anna moves on her journey, grateful for your small size, as it meant you could allow her to walk for you without really feeling guilty. You weighed next to nothing, and because of that it was a simple matter for her to walk while carrying you, even with added weights of both the pads, and the pouch itself.

Outside your view of the world slipped by, the white clouds dotting the sky, a bit more than had been there before, but still nothing to worry about. Taking a look at the sun you found it was about a quarter hour past the noonday position, your journey having originally going to start a little before ten in the morning, and then getting delayed by almost an hour and a half thanks to your battle with Clara, and then that long, drawn out scene between Gary and Anna.

All in all though, it was a nice day to be out, and you snuggled against one of the pads, feeling the way it conformed to your body, creating an ultra soft cushion around you as you watched the world roll by outside, almost as if you were in a car or something, and not riding inside a pouch on some girl's hip as she walked through the woods.

Yawning to yourself you laid your head down on the pad, and soon you were snoring, little sighs of the word Ditto drifting into her ear as Anna made her way towards the nearest town. Smiling she decided to let you sleep as she walked, used to the day long treks from her time gathering specimen pokemon for her Great Grandfather.

You slept for over an hour in your little space, the rocking motion of Anna's gait keeping you asleep and happy. Until suddenly you bolted up, your sense of pokemon telling you one was coming up fast, just before a nearby tree rustled a bit with it's coming, and a form shot out into the middle of the path to bar your way.
151122212212221112111211111111111111111.title: An Encounter? At Random?! ::GASP::

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
Looking at the thing you realized it wasn't that much bigger than you, and was just one of the usual pokemon one would expect to see on any Route, though this particular Pidgey looked more than a little determined, its eyes telling you that it wasn't going to move without a fight, a short one from the way it held itself, almost falling over.

"What do you want?" you ask it, and the Pidgey's head rises up at you leaning completely on one side as it looks at you for a moment.

"Food. Want your food. Give it to me, and I'll let you pass unharmed," it tell you, and listening closely you can actually hear it's stomach growl. The thing was obviously malnourished. It's bad grammar likely a result of its condition rather than some mental problem or a speech impediment, making it a thing of pity.

Taking a moment to study the Pidgey, you know it can't possibly stand up to you. Heck one of your moves might kill it, but it obviously won't let you pass without either surrendering some food, or battling it, and so you are forced into a difficult decision. Before you can make it though, Anna interjects into your thoughts as she looks at the pokemon.

"Oh, you poor thing. Must be starving, aren't you?" she asks as you feel her shift and move behind you, reaching into the pack. You hear her open one of the pockets, and then she pulls something out before zipping it back up. Waiting for her, you wonder just what's in her hand as she pulls back and then tosses something at the pidgey, which comes into your field of vision a moment later.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: The Road is Blocked By a Hungry Guard

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
The red and white ball sailed into your sight and then lightly tapped the Pidgey on the head, and in truth you half expected the hungry pokemon to faint from the strike, but it stays standing as it's features become less distinct, the pokeball transforming it into light and data that is then consumed by the orb, which snaps shut and starts wobbling on the ground, emitting an odd tone as it tries to contain the creature within.

For a few tense moments you and Anna both stare at the pokeball, wondering if you will indeed have to battle the creature as it breaks out, but these moments are short lived, as soon the ball stops wobbling, and the sound from inside dies with a whine.

"Alright, my first capture!" says Anna, excited obviously, despite the overall nature of the event. Of course, you can understand her excitement. After all, though she'd supposedly been capturing pokemon for Oak, this was the first one she did all on her own, and hadn't been passed to her by her father, or joined her for a very odd reason, as you had.

"So, what do you think we should name her?" she asked you, and you wonder why she called it a her, when you suddenly realize that Anna had been hunting these creatures for a long time, and could possibly tell gender at a glance. Of course you can only say your own name and she shakes her head at the idea as she walks over to the pokeball and picks it up, holding her prize in one hand.

"I know, how about Lightwing?" she suggests after a moment of things and you nod. A bird pokemon starved near to death was likely very light at that, and you watched as she held the ball in her hand another moment before.....
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: Lightwing, the Pidgey

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
"Okay, come on out Lightwing," she said, not shouting but just saying it as she lobbed the pokeball overhand, allowing it to soar through the air again as she walked towards it, her hands already digging into her pack and pulling out the box of pokemon treats she'd gotten earlier. According do the label on the side eating a single one was like a full meal for most pokemon, and it listed out beside the types this was true for, and even how many to give the larger pokemon.

In Lightwing's case, even if it had been a two or three beside it's name, you would have hoped Anna would have had sense enough to only give the poor creature one for the moment, as eating a large meal after going hungry for a long while was one of the worst things you could do to your body, or so you'd heard several times in your Health and Fitness class back in school.

Watching outside the pouch you see the Pidgey, now Lightwing, reappear in almost the same fashion it had vanished, though as it slowly became more detailed you noticed it was kneeling down, almost half dead, and looking even worse than it had when she'd caught it just moments ago. You stayed alert, just in case it tried to attack Anna, but as you got closer you decided to be more pro-active and leapt from your perch, to stand in between the pokemon and human.

"Hey, Lightwing, you want some food?" you asked it, and its head rose up a bit, looking towards you for a moment, and you thought it might attack you, until Anna placed her hand in front of you and held out the pokemon treat to it. The Pidgey sniffed at the offered ball of food for a moment, before opening its beak weakly and leaning forward towards it slowly, cautiously. Anna, giggling, moved it closer and almost shoved it into the things mouth.

"Heh, go on, eat up. There's plenty more where that came from," she told it, and you watched an immediate effect in the creature as it got some food down its throat, leaping into the air it trilled as it flew around, working the food into its system. Absently, Anna withdrew another treat from the box, and you thought she was going to give it to Lightwing, but then, suddenly, she held it out to you, and you realized then that you hadn't eaten since the night before, your belly giving off a growl.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: To Dine, or Not To Dine

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
Taking the ball of stuff in your hands you are again reminded of your stature as being a little less than a grass stain, but still, you have a big appetite, and an even bigger mouth, which you open up wide and literally shove the hole ball into your mouth, getting only a little taste from it, not unlike the sandwich last night. Anna, watching you eat, laughs again as she walks over to a tree and leans back against it, setting her pack beside her and drawing out one of the wrapped sandwiches to munch on herself.

"Heh, keep eating like that and we'll have you nice and big in no time," she says through a mouth full of bologna and cheese, poking you in your stomach and then setting her attention on her meal as Lightwing lands beside her. Looking up at Lightwing you are a bit struck by the size difference, with her head almost four times your height off the ground.

"You are pretty small for a Ditto. And you sounded weird before too. Tell me, are you not from around here?" asks the Pidgey, and you stare at it. Considering it was only a low leveled pokemon, you had expected it to sound like a child, but the voice that came out of its beak as it looked down at you was that of a grown woman, at least half again Anna's age.

"Well that's because I'm not a Ditto," you tell her as you smile, and she gets an odd expression on her face, leaning down, causing you to move back a bit, afraid she was going to snap you up to taste you, but instead getting a deep sniff.

"You smell like the Ditto's around here," she tells you as she leans back, regaining her full height and you consider for a moment. Lightwing seems bright, but would she really be able to understand you being human. It might be best to just make something simpler up, and face consequences later if she figures it out.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: Lunchtime Discussions

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
"Well, I'm not even a pokemon. Or at least I wasn't before yesterday," you begin, and the Pidgey looks at you oddly, though she doesn't seem about to interrupt, obviously wanting to withhold her judgement of your story until she's heard the whole thing, which is more than you can say most humans you knew would have done had your situation been a reverse, with a pokemon being turned into a human.

"Yesterday I woke up like this, and then ran into Anna, our trainer," you point to her, and for the first time realize that you do indeed think of Anna in those terms at the moment, despite the fact that you are here just for her to take you to oak, rather than as an actual pokemon. Looking over at her, you find she's still eating her snack, watching the two of you talk. You grin at her, and she returns it, likely having no idea what thoughts are going through your head, or even what you're telling Lightwing.

"Before that I was a human boy. I went to school, ate, slept, and lived with my parents. That was the sum total of my life for the most part. I wanted to go on a pokemon training adventure of course, just to see how far I could go with it, but I didn't have drive to go do it," admitting that, you sigh, as you really hadn't though about it like that before, merely having pushed it aside every time it had come up in a discussion with your parents.

"After running into Anna, she tried to battle me, but I took down several of her dad's pokemon, who were fully leveled, and then, after she started crying and I went over to comfort her, I turned into her too, and got my story out, or at least, enough of it," you now realize she didn't even know your name or where you were from, just that you were human.

For a moment, you wished you'd told her your parents phone number, so she could call them and tell them you're all right, but then you shake the thought aside. You don't want your parents to see you like this, and just telling them you're alright would only make them worry even more. Heck, they might even think Anna kidnaped you somehow, and send the police after her.

"Then, together we went to her home, tried to find her great grandfather, who's the most famous Pokemon Prof. in the world, only to discover he was gone. So now we're on a pokemon journey, with me as her starter, and we're gonna go find Prof. Oak and set everything right again, or so I hope," you finally finish, and look at Lightwing, wondering if she understood all that, and, probably more importantly, whether or not she believed it all.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: Explaining Things to Lightwing

choices: You get to the next town unmolested
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
"Hmm, that's quite a story your telling me little one," she says, hoping over to you and laying down, bringing her head a bit closer to your's, which basically means she's laying flat on the ground with her head right in front of you. Listening to her words, you sigh and turn away. Not like you really expected her to believe such a wild tale, even if she understood it which, considering her words, you think she must have done.

"However, that story's just a bit too wild to be something someone makes up. Especially since there are much easier lies to tell that would have had the same effect," she says at last and before you really know what you're doing you leap over on top of her beak and give it a hug. Of course, when you come back to yourself you instantly let go, and back off a bit, blushing as you turn your back to Lightwing's stare.

"Um, thanks Lightwing, that means a lot to me that you believe me," you say at last, trying to calm yourself down, and then you suddenly feel a pressing coming from behind you, and spinning yourself around, you find that the Pidgey is nuzzling into you with her beak, almost in a motherly fashion that gets you to hugging her again.

"Aw, now I really wish I understood pokemon," came the voice of Anna, and looking over you see that she's been watching the two of you this whole time, and placing te last bite of her sandwich into her mouth she smiles at the two of you, getting up and crushing the wrapper of her snack in her hand before placing it inside one of the pockets of her pack, designed for just such items.

"Okay, well I guess you should go back in your pokeball for now Lightwing," she said, returning the Pidgey to the ball and placing it inside her pouch, before leaning down and scooping you up. Smiling at you she seems to be about to give you an affectionate kiss, but holds off, slipping you into the pouch beside the pokeball, and then starting to walk. Luckily, her pouch was designed to hold the orb in place, and so it doesn't come any closer to you as you snuggle into the pads, wondering what Anna will run into next.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: A Sentimental Moment

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
Oddly, at least to you, the rest of Anna's journey along the route is uneventful. You can of course sense the other pokemon, all along the trail, and sometimes you tense when one starts to move closer, but then they always back off, running back into the woods literally just before they come to the path. You know they're no scared of the road through the woods either, because when you're on it you can feel pokemon both behind and ahead.

"Heh, guess they're still scared of me, even without Daddy's pokemon," she comments to herself, though the comment answers your question. Of course the pokemon avoid her. They're smart enough to recognize this girl as a hunter of sorts, capturing specimens for Oak's lab along the route. Heck, she'd probably been doing that for months now, and after a while the pokemon learned to recognize her.

"Oh well, maybe we'll have more battles along the next route," she says at least and you look out of the pouch to study the scene before you. Ahead is a town, cast in the light of the dusk, and the setting sun no longer visible on the horizon, though it's light continues to wash over the area for the moment. This place, though bigger than Anna's hometown, is still not really a city, though in plain view you can see a Pokemon Center, and almost right next to it, a Gym, with three odd curved symbols on it.

"That's Mac's Gym. The three symbols represent Earth, Wind, and Fire, his three Elements of Life," she explains, this time you know it's to you as she opens the flap to the pouch and stares in at you with a smile on her face.

"I kinda figured you wouldn't know that. It's not a very famous Gym, but Mac's supposed to be one of the strongest Gym Leaders in this region, and that means that beat him is gonna take everything we've got, so how about we go rest first?" the last is actually a question, and you smile up at her, sliding over to the edge of the pouch and looking towards the two buildings, trying to decide what you want to do for now. Both appear to be open, and after a second of consideration you point towards.....
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: To Bed or Battle? That is the Question

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
when u got to ur room u decide to test out ur abily to change into other humans. Anna was laying on her bed with her eyes closed trying to sleep. After concentrating on her form u changed into her again. It was stressful but u new u could retain this form for at least 10 minutes if u tried hard enough. U went to wake up anna.

Hey wake up! You said in her feminine voice.

Anna quickly woke up to see herself standing infront of her.

Ditto is that u?
Yeah. Isnt this great i was practicing while u were asleep and this happend. You said
Wow this is great. But i got some questions that need to be answered. First off tell me....
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: Becoming Anna again

choices: Explain to Anna the solution. Get ready for an adventure.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content: Suddenly everything goes black, and when you wake up, after gaining memory of when you were "morphed" you recall, that there was a semi-solution to this "problem". Every badge had a magical property to it, which can allow you to stay as your original form for an hour more. After getting all the badges you can live a semi-normal life, turning into a ditto for 1 hour, then being human for the rest of the 23. So if you finish the journey for the badges with Anna, you can become normal again.
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: The Solution

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
But you weren't sure about this. How could that happen? It was just randomly placed in your dream which, come to think of it, you can't remember. Still, it might be the only way to get back to your normal self.

You look at the clock in your room, which says midnight, and start curling up in your little ball, but can't seem to. Then you start feeling different, as if your body is expanding, becoming tighter. You feel hair, which makes you happy, until you realise it's longer then your hair. The pad you're sleeping in is suddenly too small, and you need to get out. You try to slide, but can't. So you use your fingers to get out. Wait, fingers? You also seem to have legs, but they're not yours, or at least don't feel like yours. Then it hits you. You're turning into Anna... again!
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: Random Generic Choice #2

1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.content:
Remembering how early she woke up the first time you slept, you're not surprised that much to see her roll over, rub her eyes and then open them. Anna, however, is very surprised to see her twin back, instantly sitting up.

"Ditto?" she asked.

"Yeah, it's me," you respond. Recalling the question she asked you, you add, "and for the record, my name is John*," The weirdness of you using a male name while having a female body does occur to you, but if it does to Anna, she ignores it.

"Oh, so that's what your name is," she says, looking at you curiously. "Well, that's my first question answered, so I'll ask the next one. What were you like before you were a Ditto?"

You remember telling this to Lightwing earlier today (or was it yesterday?) and begin telling the story in full, along with an extra detail you forgot: "And when I woke up as a Ditto, the other Pokemon were talking about a weird flash of light. It was probably when I arrived,"

"I... see," responds Anna. "You really were a human before. Have you tried transforming back into your own body?"

"Yeah. I was attempting to transform into you or myself before. Only one experiment worked, and I think you can guess which one."

The silence that follows is long. You know you and Anna are both thinking the same thing, and not just because you have the same bodies. The dream that you had is doubtful, possibly caused by you brain desperately wanting to turn you back into a human. It could even have been the part that always wanted to go on a Pokemon journey, and was only now able to make a good excuse via you being a Ditto.

Anna breaks the silence. "We should get some sleep. I only booked a room for one person, so you should probably go back to being a Ditto. If you can transform back into me, we'll talk again tomorrow night, okay?"

"That's fine. Bye, Anna," you say as you start to reform into a Ditto.

"Wait!" Anna exclaims. "One last thing! Should I call you John* or Ditto?"

You're slightly shocked that when you think about it, you don't really care what she calls you. "I don't mind either way," are your last words as...
1511222122122211121112111111111111111111.title: A Conversation at Midnight

As the smoke cleared I could see Charazard laying on the floor knocked out "well that new partner of yours is defiantly powerful Max and I'm sure you and him will go for on your journey" "thanks bro naw if you don't mind I need to go pack" the next day we set of on are Journey after saying are good byes. so were next?
1531121111221.title: The chat

15311211112211.content:
As you both get ready to leave Max says good bye to his family as they wish you both a safe journey. You then proceed on where you both see a sad looking Dragonaire.

Mewtwo's View
"This pokémon seems so sad..." You walk over and ask it what's wrong it slowly speaks. "My trainer ditched me!" "What? How could he do that to you! Would you like to accompany us?" "Really? You mean it, he won't ditch me will he?" "No, and your a beautiful lady." She bushes at this you walk over to max.

Maxes View
Mewtwo walks up to you and says "The Dragonair is female, and would like to travel with us." "Oh wow! When she evolves she will be strong." "I know that already." "Guess I'll catch her." You walk up to her and say "You want to travel with us?" She nods and says "Dragonair!" "Welcome aboard." As you slowly tap her with the pokéball.

Dragonaires View
"This trainer seems to care for me, I hope it stays this way." You soon are pulled outside the pokéball to see your trainer "Hi there girl, my names max. Would you like me to get you something to eat?" You think about it before you slowly nod. Now that your stomachs growls.

Maxes View
As you walk downstairs towards the kitchen you then make your special food made for certain types you had always had a knack for it. You went to school for many years about this stuff. In less than half an hour you are finally done and make yourself something, before heading upstairs.

Mewtwo's View
"I sense masters return." "I'm hungry, hope he has food." "Hey I'm back. Here's food for you guys." They both walk up to you well... Dragonair skids over more like. You hand them both a dish. They try it and you can tell you like it. As they give their approval.

"Let me check your moves. Let's see mewtwo you know psycic, recover, safeguard, and rest. Dragonair knows Flamethrower, Ice Beam, Thunder Bolt and Dragon Breath."

15311211121.title: C) Join the police

153112111211.content:
"There's been a massive disturbance found along the Lake of Rage. We suspect work of Team Cosmos." Jenny says to you

"Team Cosmos?" You wonder aloud

"Yes. Ever since Team Rocket and Galactic were taken down they've joined forces and have been doing considerable damage. We need you to go and do reconnaissance."

"As you wish" You say teleporting to the Lake of Rage.You hear a voice and decide to hide.

"Yeah, the boss says he wants to see how our little project is doing" You see the cause of the voice. A man wearing a suit of all black with a silver streak going from his right shoulder to his left leg and a violet streak from his left shoulder to his right leg.

"Hmm... He seem to know what's going on. I could just use Hypnosis and bend him to my will. But maybe a less conventional method is in order" you think of torture and interrogation. After some thought you decide to...
153112111211.title: Team Cosmos

choices: "What are you doing at Lake of Rage?"
1531121112112.content:
"Stop!" you yell telepathically at the man in the suit

"Who's there?" He yells taking out a Dusk Ball "Ariados, find this intruder!"

With a flash dark as shadows, you see and Ariados appear in front of the strange man

"HmmHmmHmmHmmHmm" You snicker emerging from your hiding place. "You think you can challenge me? I'll crush this insect and then you'll be next"

"We see about that. You're obviously a Psychic type. A Bug type should have no trouble taking you down!" So this human is well informed. No matter, this bug will be flattened

"Ariados hit it with Poison Jab!" the man yells, but it doesn't matter. As Ariados lunged at you with legs seeped in toxins, it was halted midair. "Feel the power of my Psycho Cut!" you say as an arc of pure telekinetic energy blasts Ariados back to it's trainer. You scoff as it meekly stands up again

"You haven't had enough yet? Fine. I'll end this now" You say as you clap your hands together and they tun black as night. As you expand the distance between them a dark sphere emerges.

"Shadow Ball!" you yell. Ariados tried dodging, but it was futile. You had taken down the Ariados with no trouble at all.

"Ariados!" The trainer yelled clutching his pokemon.

"This ends now" you say approaching this unconscious bug fists blackened again.

"WAIT!" The trainer pleads "Please. Ariados was my first pokemon and my best friend. My dad caught me a Spinarak as my first pokemon and all the kids at school made fun of me because they had Koffings or Magnemites. We're best friends. Please" He says on the verge of tears.

"Fine." You say calling back the shadows "But I'm looking for answers, and you're going to give them to me." You inform this man as you levitate him helplessly into the air.

"First question."
1531121112112.title: Insecticide

15311211121121.content:
"Who are you? And what role do you play for Team Cosmos?" You demand to know

"I'm scientist Jackson Riley." The man admits scared "I lead the machinery design and manufacturing here."

"What type of machines?" You ask angry as you gaze into his terror filled eyes with your fierce ones

"I'm not entirely sure." Jackson admits "Our commander ordered us to create a device to send out pulsing hypersonic waves. The machines were to be powered by different evolutionary stones. For example if we powered the device with a water stone and Staryu were around, they'd evolve, but pokemon like Flaffy would remain unaffected."

"What about branch evolution?" You wonder aloud expecting an answer.

"That's why we're only to use one stone at a time. We also designed the sonic radius to be manually monitored." Jackson admits.

"Interesting." You think aloud "You said a commander was here before. Who is it and where can I find them?"

"The leader for the Lake of Rage project is Commander..."
15311211121121.title: "Who are you?"

"AAAAAHH!!" they both screamed.

You then proceed to fly away.

You decied to fly off. Anyway, there's no point in hanging around. You shot out of the tree, hearing a gasp from the boy, but your out of there sight in a second.
You find ourself over the ocean again, and simply dift over the calm waters. And then an idea hits you. Can you control the weather? You don't know the answer, so you wave your hand, which glows blue. You wave your hand one way, and the clouds seem to follow it..What kind of weather will you create?

There is a boy with six Poke B alls at his belt below you. He is looking around the area furtively, as if trying to avoid detection. You try to stay as still as possible so he won't see you up there, but your legs and back are beginning to cramp up something terrible from spending the night in a tree, and to be honest you're getting a bit hungry.

"Hmmm..." He says, "There aren't ANY pokemon out today..."

You continue to try and stay still, but you just cannot help it any longer. Trying to move silently, you lose your balance and land right on top of him.

*CRASH!*

Both of you get to your feet. It's a small wonder you're unharmed! At first, the trainer is a bit dazed, but after catching sight of you, an obviously rare Pokemon, he snaps out of it and reaches for his pokedex. His jaw nearly hits the floor as he reads what his pokedex has to say about you. The trainer is reaching for one of his pokemon, what will you do?

155.content:
You wake up in a cave, but it's not very dark, and there are small puddles of water. Gently, you try to walk forward, but your feet are too small, and you trip forward. However, you don't fall, and instead continue to float forward as if you were walking. You wonder what's going on.

You gently poke out of the cave, and see the dark night sky, with the moon illuminating the lake that surrounds the cave. You continue to floar over to the edge of the land, and peek at your reflection. As you expected, you're no longer a human. You've become...
155.title: Mesprit?

1551.content:
In the water, you see the reflection of a pokemon with a plump blue body, two long tails, each bearing a jewel, and what would apear to be a pink mask fitted over the head. Four droopy ears hung down, and a jewl was fitted on the forehead.

You gently reach for it with your stubby arms, and are unable to pull it off, leading you to believe it's not a mask. It's your face. In a quick panic, you yearn to get away from here.

Without thinking, your body shoots into the air, your two tails dangling in the wind behind you. You can see everything from the air. You need to land somewhere.
1551.title: Not a mask

15512.content:
Elsewhere...

"Lapras, Surf over to that cave."

A Trainer, looking to complete his Pokedex, was looking for the legendary Mesprit. He knew that upon him seeing it, it would flee, but he had come prepared. What he had not come prepared for was no Mesprit.

He scanned the surrounding area, and thought he saw a tail in the sky, but dismissed it.

Back with you. In your rush to get to... somewhere, you recall Mesprit's pokedex entry, to see if there was anything important.

Mesprit, the Emotion Pokemon. Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain and joy. It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

Not much, except for the fact that you are now "the being of emotion". As you try to think of something that could be relevant to that, you realise that you are not really controlling your body anymore, sort of.

"What the?!" you try to exclaim, but it comes out weird, undescribably weird. You try diving into your body, and succeed, but not before you already got to your body's destination.

Where was it?
15512.title: In another small lake

you hunted out food and suddenly saw a small pokemon lighting a flame. From pokemon school you immediatly notice it as a...

info.brief_description: One Day, you wake up as a pokemon.
info.description:
You were just a normal kid, and have no idea why, but you woke up as a pokemon today. As you travel around, you can always embrace this wonderful gift, or try and get back to normal and away from this horrible curse.

-The character can understand both pokemon & humans, but only other pokemon can understand him.
-No killing the main character
-Vore, Sex, exc. is allowed if it isn't overdone.
-Try to add atleast 2-3 sentences, and don't add anything too large(10 paragraphs 10 sentences long)
-I do edit, but only minor things.
-If you add pokemon with the "Other" Option, atleast make the first chapter of each pokemon you add. If not, You Will NOT get GP's.
-Please, Please, PLEASE, Try to make the character Gender nuetral. Gender before becoming a pokemon is irrelevent, and it can turn people away from adding if the main character is male, while they are female, or vice versa. Even in situations with single gendered pokemon (For example, Miltank is female only) either make it nuetral, or the starting gender is the same as the pokemon's gender. This is NOT a transgender story.
